title: Senior Brand Manager (E-Commerce / D2C)
description:
About the Role

Kranis B.V. is looking for an experienced Senior Brand Manager (E-Commerce) to take full ownership of our D2C brand operations. This role is highly strategic and hands-on, with full responsibility for managing and scaling our e-commerce brands across all brand-related functions excluding marketplace/platform operations.



You will be responsible for driving brand growth for two of our D2C brands—Minismus and Matakumi—with a strong focus on Shopify performance, pricing strategy, merchandising, conversion rate optimization, SEO, paid media, and brand presence across digital channels.



This is a senior role requiring proven experience managing high-revenue D2C brands or equivalent agency-level expertise.



Key Responsibilities

Own and manage the overall brand strategy for Kranis B.V.’s D2C brands

Lead all e-commerce brand initiatives across Shopify stores, including:

Pricing strategy and merchandising

Conversion Rate Optimization (CVR)

SEO optimization and website performance

Oversee and optimize paid media efforts, including
 Ads and Google Ads

Manage and align social media presence with brand strategy

Analyze performance data across e-commerce, marketing, and brand channels to drive growth and profitability

Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to ensure consistent brand execution

Continuously identify opportunities to improve brand positioning, customer experience, and revenue performance



Requirements

5+ consecutive years of experience managing a D2C brand (Shopify-based) with:

10M+ annual revenue, OR

5+ consecutive years working in an agency managing D2C brands at this level

Strong, hands-on experience with Shopify



Proven expertise in:

D2C e-commerce strategy

Pricing and merchandising

CVR and SEO optimization

Paid advertising (Meta & Google)

Highly analytical, data-driven, and commercially minded

Strong leadership, ownership mindset, and ability to manage multiple brand functions

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills



What We Offer

Competitive salary package

Full-time, stable role with long-term growth opportunities

Collaborative and performance-driven work environment

Opportunity to take full ownership of established and growing D2C brands



How to Apply :

We can only accept candidates who apply through our application form.



Instructions :

1. Copy and paste the application form link into your browser

2. Make sure there are no extra spaces before or after the link

description:
Full-Stack Engineer (Next.js + Strapi)



Product: 
 + Internal Talent CRM

Location: Remote

Compensation: Starting at $5,000/month (flexible based on experience)



?



About the Company




 is a digital talent scouting platform that connects aspiring models with agencies and industry scouts worldwide. The business relies on a public-facing submission platform and a private CRM used to review applications, manage talent profiles, track outreach, and support placements.



We’re looking for an engineer who can help strengthen and scale both systems.



?

You will own development across:

)

 • Role-based access controls

This is a high-ownership role. You will work directly with stakeholders to ship production-ready features quickly and cleanly.



?



Tech Stack

?

?

Required

Nice to Have

?

?



Why This Role

title: Lead Fullstack Developer – Web Applications & Infrastructure
description:
About the Role

We are looking for a highly skilled and passionate Fullstack Developer to join us in building sophisticated, high-performance web applications. You won't just be writing code; you will be a key partner in architecting complex digital solutions from the ground up. If you are someone who thrives on technical challenges and takes pride in building applications that are as robust as they are scalable, we want to talk to you.



Your Profile



Expert in Web Apps: You have a deep understanding of modern web technologies and a proven track record of developing complex, interactive applications.



Fullstack Mastery: You are equally comfortable crafting seamless user interfaces as you are architecting powerful backends.



Infrastructure & DevOps: You don't stop at "it works on my machine." You have solid experience with databases (SQL/NoSQL), server management, and cloud infrastructure to ensure our applications are deployed securely and run reliably at scale.



Security Mindset: You understand that a great application must be a secure one. You implement best practices for data protection and system stability.



Problem Solver: You enjoy tackling ambitious projects and finding elegant solutions to difficult technical requirements.



What We Offer



The opportunity to work on high-impact projects with a focus on quality and innovation.



A collaborative environment where your technical expertise directly shapes the product.



The chance to take full ownership of the development lifecycle—from the first line of code to a secure production environment.



Let’s Build Something Great Together.

If you are a tech-driven developer who lives and breathes web applications, send us your portfolio and your CV. We are looking for a long-term partner to push the boundaries of what’s possible.

title: Fullstack AI Engineer – LLM & Custom Infrastructure
description:
The Mission

We are looking for a visionary Fullstack AI Engineer who doesn't just call APIs, but builds and hosts the future of our agency's intelligence. Your goal is to create a proprietary AI platform where we can train, deploy, and interact with custom models—fully hosted on our own secure infrastructure.



Your Role & Responsibilities



Self-Hosted AI: You will architect and deploy large language models (LLMs) or specialized AI models on our own servers to ensure maximum data privacy and performance.



Platform Development: You will build a sophisticated web-based interface (Fullstack) that allows users to interact with our AIs and manage training processes.



Custom Training & Fine-Tuning: You are responsible for setting up pipelines to train and fine-tune models with our own datasets to solve specific agency challenges.



End-to-End Infrastructure: You manage everything from the database layer and server-side processing to the frontend delivery, ensuring a seamless and secure user experience.



Your Technical Profile



AI & Machine Learning: Deep expertise in AI frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow) and experience in hosting open-source models (like Llama, Mistral, etc.) on private GPU servers.



Fullstack Mastery: Proficient in modern web technologies for building the platform's UI and robust backend services.



Data Engineering: Strong knowledge of vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Milvus, Weaviate) and training data preparation.



DevOps & Security: Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and securing AI environments against external threats.



Who You Are



You are a "builder" at heart who loves to bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI research and practical, high-performance web applications.



You are comfortable working with complex server environments and understand how to optimize AI inference for speed and reliability.

title: GBP Specialist
description:
About Us



Door & Gate Domination is a performance-focused digital agency that specializes in custom website development, SEO, and local digital marketing for garage door, gate, and home service businesses. We are currently looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Google Business Profile (GBP) Specialist to manage and optimize client GBP listings to improve local visibility and lead generation. The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of local SEO best practices, is experienced in handling GBP issues and suspensions, and can communicate clearly with internal teams.



Key Responsibilities:



Manage and optimize Google Business Profile listings for multiple clients across various locations.

Ensure NAP (Name, Address, Phone Number) consistency across online directories and local citations.

Monitor GBP for updates, suspensions, reviews, and Q&A activity.

Post regular updates, photos, and service highlights in line with client branding.

Respond to customer reviews with professionalism, ensuring proper tone and context.

Troubleshoot and escalate issues related to GBP suspensions or verification problems.

Collaborate with the SEO and content teams to ensure local SEO alignment.

Report regularly on GBP performance metrics such as views, calls, and direction requests.

Stay up-to-date with changes to GBP guidelines and best practices.



Qualifications:



Proven experience managing and optimizing Google Business Profile listings, preferably in an agency setting.

Strong understanding of local SEO, citations, and review management.

Experience resolving common GBP issues, including suspensions and duplicate listings.

Familiarity with GBP tools and platforms (e.g., BrightLocal, Whitespark, or similar).

Familiarity with using Multilogin for managing multiple GBP profiles securely and efficiently

Excellent written communication skills for handling reviews and communicating with tea
mbers.

Highly organized with strong attention to detail and follow-through.

Comfortable creating short Loom videos to explain GBP performance or issues.

Able to manage multiple client accounts efficiently.

Fluent in English, both written and spoken

Highly responsive and detail-oriented, with excellent communication and coordination skills





Nice-to-Have Skills:



Familiarity with
 Local Ads and Yelp Campaigns

Background in team leadership or remote staff supervision

Knowledge of content strategy, including collaboration with SEO writers

Familiarity with tools like Google Search Console, Google Analytics, or local rank trackers.

Basic knowledge of on-page SEO to align with local optimization efforts.

Experience with Google Ads for local campaigns.





Work Schedule:



Full-time position (remote).

Monday to Friday, 8 am to 5 pm CST

Willing to use time-tracking tools



Why Join Us?



Join a specialized digital marketing agency focused on helping local businesses grow.

Work with a collaborative, fast-paced, and supportive team.

Be a key player in improving clients' local visibility and lead generation.

Room for growth and expansion into broader local SEO responsibilities.

title: Amazon PPC Executive
description:
About Heroes

Heroes buys, operates, and scales baby and juvenile brands.



We are ambitious multi-brand developers combining operational excellence with customer-centricity to support parents and children through every milestone of their journey. Built by a team with a background in investment banking, venture capital, and D2C eCommerce, we have the right experience to nurture and grow brands and develop products that simplify, support, and enrich everyday family experiences.



At Heroes, we leave our egos behind, get our hands dirty, and push through obstacles to get things over the finish line. If this sounds like you, you should join us.



About the role

Heroes are looking for an experienced Amazon PPC Executive to drive key marketing activities, ensuring that our products appear high for the most relevant keyword searches.



The successful candidate will play a very pivotal role in the success and growth of the Heroes brand portfolio and be responsible for the efficient management of a significant spend budget for their brand.



Responsibilities:



In-depth and methodical keyword research - identifying important high, medium & low volume keywords to target and implementing a strategy to build rank for these.



Campaign implementation - hands-on execution and management of keyword ranking strategies.



Analysing past performance of current and new products, identifying opportunities to push performance further.



Working with our current portfolio of brands across multiple markets to help drive efficient sales.



Providing summarised and detailed reporting of key performance metrics and driving actions based on the data.



Working highly proactively with the brand management team, offering a wider perspective on product strategy as well as recommendations to grow the brand and product(s).



Being a trusted partner to your assigned Brand Manager, owning the PPC operations, driving their brands, and supporting them with insights that drive the commercial success of the brand(s).



Identifying market trends, driving the use of new features and tactics, and staying up-to-date on what’s happening within the industry.



Onboarding and integrating new brands, setting up a scalable campaign structure that allows for profitable growth.



Working with selected tools such as Helium10, Jungle Scout, Perpetua to analyse keywords, search volumes, and key performance metrics.



About you:



You should have proven experience in managing Amazon PPC campaigns, with a track record of driving profitable growth.



A strong understanding and total ownership of the cause and effect of your actions is crucial.



You will have experience managing marketing campaigns for a wide range of products on Amazon across multiple markets, with knowledge on non-PPC growth drivers.



You should be able to analyse and present performance data clearly and concisely while still being able to drill down to a high level of detail where necessary.



You will have experience using technologies and automation tools (e.g Helium10, Jungle Scout, Perpetua) to help manage activity, but also be able to demonstrate a good understanding of how these function.



You will be highly numerate and able to make informed, data driven decisions. Excellent attention to detail is essential.



You will have a strong ability of leveraging data to communicate your points to colleagues and other stakeholders.



Our benefits

15 days of paid vacation per year.

Remote Work

A standard 40-hour work week.

Please note: We require the successful candidate to align their working hours with the UK time zone.



Heroes is an equal opportunity employer looking to build a diverse, inclusive team. We hire based purely on business need, skillset, and competence and do not consider age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity, race, religion or belief, or marriage or civil partnerships when making hiring decisions.

title: Customer Experience & Operations Associate (E-commerce Coffee Company) *Full Time, Remote | Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
Are you ready…

To start a role that motivates and excites you?

And a position where we invest in your learning, education, and growth?



Then keep reading, we want to work with you!





WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS POSITION:

This is not your typical support role — you’ll work directly with our founders, influence company-wide systems, and gain exposure to every part of the business.



Incredible company culture:

• Small, close team with collaborative, friendly and open culture.

• We believe the biggest asset of a company is our people. We focus on helping each tea
mber reach their full potential by investing in their learning, growth, skills, and education. When we grow as individuals, we succeed as a team.

• Not a fan of office politics or drama? We’re on the same page. Instead of wasting time with that, we focus on solving problems and reaching goals

• 100% remote, enjoy the comfort and flexibility of working from home



Pay, benefits, progression, and long-term growth:

• Competitive salary

• Benefits including up to 16 days a year Paid Time off

• Progression as we grow: greater responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased pay.

• Feel empowered, make decisions, have an impact

• Grow with the company and live up to your potential!

• Join an exciting, fast-growing company!







ABOUT US:

We’re a young, ambitious, and small (but growing!) company that’s making a massive impact in ecommerce. 



Since 2015 we’ve been obsessed with building award-winning products and awesome brands that people fall in love with. We have 2 primary brands in our portfolio: 

(1) an international award-winning coffee products brand 
 / 
).

(2) an educational coaching program that helps entrepreneurs grow their businesses to create a positive impact in the world!



Our two recent flagship products became the world’s most successful launches in their categories. We’ve shipped more than 200,000 orders worldwide and we’re continuing to expand.



Our culture is transparent and candid. You’re always welcome (and encouraged!) to ask questions or express a difference of opinion. Learning and growth is a cornerstone of our culture, both personally and professionally. We work hard, and we have fun!







WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented team player to fill this role—someone who thrives on solving problems, staying organized, and making things run smoothly across departments.



Do you love helping customers, supporting a team, and keeping operations organized? Do you get satisfaction from making systems work better and “getting things done”? If yes, we want you on our team!



You’re probably the type of person who:

• Enjoys supporting others and finding solutions to problems

• Has strong communication and organizational skills

• Likes working behind the scenes to make sure everything runs like clockwork

• Is excited to wear multiple hats and be part of a growing, fast-moving company

• Has worked directly with founders or in a startup, and enjoys that fast-paced, flexible vibe

We’re not just looking for someone who can support our team, we’re looking for someone to be proactive with taking ownership of tasks, solve problems independently, and grow into larger responsibilities over time.







YOUR OPPORTUNITY AND ROLE ON THE TEAM:

Our culture is collaborative, friendly, and open. We hire people who are smart, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn and grow.



Sound like you? This is an exciting long-term opportunity!



This is a fully remote position. You’ll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our small but mighty team to support customer happiness, streamline operations, and take on projects that help the business grow. 



This is a foundational role — one where you’ll gain visibility into all parts of the company.



As you grow, your role will grow with you, based on your interests and strengths:

• Want to work improving our systems and processes? Awesome!

• Have ideas on how to improve our website? Fantastic!

• Want to learn how to manage projects? Let’s go!



We’re not just hiring for a role — we’re hiring for potential. 



Your responsibilities will span 4 key areas: customer experience (30-40%), operations/logistics (20-30%), executive support (10-20%), and special projects (10-20%) — giving you exposure across the business. These percentages are estimates and you can expect your day-to-day to shift and evolve as the business grows and as you take ownership. 



1. Customer Experience

• Provide
/chat-based support for our customers across our channels (Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale)

• Answer order and product questions, resolve issues promptly, and ensure customers feel heard and supported

• Support wholesale partners with order updates, invoicing, and coordination



2. Order Management & Platform Coordination

• Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot orders across Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale channels

• Troubleshoot and resolve shipping or fulfillment issues with partners and customers

• Maintain accurate product listings, inventory data, and logistics information across platforms



3. Executive & Admin Support

• Manage founder and team inboxes, schedule meetings, and organize internal documentation

• Assist with travel bookings, meeting preparation, and note-taking

• Support small projects by tracking timelines, managing tasks, and ensuring follow-through



4. Special Projects & Company Operations

• Conduct research projects to support decision-making (tools, systems, competitors)

• Support lead generation efforts through identifying new wholesale prospects, brand partners, or influencers

• Support planning and execution of events, expos, or marketing campaigns — manage timelines, logistics, and tasks

• Document and maintain SOPs for operational clarity and training

• Test and troubleshoot web pages, workflows, or customer journeys to ensure quality and functionality

• Take ownership of ad hoc “figure it out” tasks — we’ll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You’ll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we’ll support your learning — but we’re looking for someone who’s excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves — as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you’ll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

• 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

• 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

• Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

• Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills — you’re detail-obsessed and on top of things

• Proactive problem-solver — you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

• Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

• Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

• Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

• Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

• Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

• Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

• “Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus”







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it’s too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you’re still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we’d love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has other benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our interview process extremely quick and efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Get started with a quick Initial Screening here for us to get to know you: 

2. Complete the screening and we’ll be in touch with next steps once we receive it.





The position is on a first come first review basis, so the sooner you complete the screening, the more likely you'll get hired.



Good luck, and we hope to have someone awesome like you to join us!

title: [HIRING] Direct Response Video Editor – High-Growth DTC Beauty Brand
description:
We are a fast-scaling DTC skincare brand on a mission to dominate the space. We don't just need a "video editor"; we need a Creative Catalyst who understands that an editor is the single most important person for a content engine.



If you are a technical wizard who thinks like a marketer, this is your chance to get in early with a brand that provides the resources for you to win.



???? THE VISION

Most brands treat editors like "order takers." We don't. We believe the right editor has the biggest leverage in creating a winning ad. We are looking for a long-term partner who wants to grow with us—moving from per-batch work to a full-time role with massive bonuses, and eventually, a Creative Director or UGC Manager position.



???? THE ROLE

- Volume: 3 to 10 high-impact videos ads per week + variations for testing.

- Direct Response Focused: You aren't just making "pretty" videos; you are building high-retention, cracked ads that convert.

- The Workflow: We provide the scripts, raw B-roll, and audio to start. However, as you integrate, you will be expected to independently manage the AI workflow.

- Sourcing: You must be able to source high-quality supplemental B-roll to fill gaps and enhance the narrative.

- AI-Integration: You must be proficient in the modern AI stack (ElevenLabs, Veo, Kling, Runway, Sora, etc.) to enhance production value and speed.



???? WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We don't just prioritize "insane editing skills". We are looking for an editor who uses a timeline as a marketing tool.

- Marketing DNA: You understand market awareness, consumer desires, avatars, and hooks.

- Strategic Brain: You don't just wait for instructions; you research, brainstorm, and contribute strategy to the team.

- Feedback Obsessed: You understand that an editor who has made a winning ad is miles apart from one who hasn't. You thrive on completing feedback loops to turn ads into winners.

- Speed & Reliability: We are growing fast. You must be able to sustain a high-velocity editing pace without sacrificing quality.



???? COMPENSATION & GROWTH

- Trial Period: Paid per batch to ensure a perfect fit.

- Full-Time Opportunity: We are actively looking for our "First Hire" anchor—if you prove your value, a competitive full-time role with a pathway to leadership + heavy bonuses is waiting.

- Vision: We won't just pay you; we will give you the space to grow, the resources to succeed, and a pathway to leadership within the company.



???? HOW TO APPLY

Do not send a generic resume. To be considered, you must provide:

- The Proof: A portfolio of Direct Response/E-com work (skincare or beauty preferred). *Mandatory*

- The Marketing Mindset: Briefly explain why one of your past ads was a "winner."

- The AI Edge: Mention which AI tools you are currently using in your workflow.

title: AI Content Creator & Video Editor (Construction & Trade Services)
description:
Overview

We are looking for a creative AI-Native Video Editor to help grow a leading German platform for home remodeling and trade services (Painters, Electricians, Landscaping, etc.). You won't just "edit" video—you will use AI to create "scroll-stopping" content that shows the magic of home transformation.



Key Responsibilities

AI-Enhanced Production: Use AI tools (Nano Banana, Midjourney, Google Veo) to generate "Satisfying" construction timelapses—like a messy room turning into a perfectly painted space.



Short-Form Mastery: Join and edit multiple clips into engaging Reels, TikToks, Shorts and Meta Ads. 

Add catchy hooks, subtitles, and transitions.



Marketing Mindset: Don't just follow instructions - think like a marketer. 

Research competitors in the remodeling and construction market and suggest content strategies that drive lead generation.



Before-and-After Transformations: Create high-quality visual "proof" of professional workmanship that builds trust with German homeowners.



Required Skills & Experience

The "All-in-One" Editor: You must be able to move fluidly between AI prompting and traditional timeline-based editing.



Advanced Video Tools: Proficiency in DaVinci Resolve (highly preferred due to its superior color grading and "Fusion" VFX) or Adobe Premiere Pro, CapCut or similar editing tools.



The "Hook" Specialist: You understand pacing, how to make the first 2 seconds of a construction-video so satisfying that people stop scrolling.



2+ Years Experience in short-form content creation (Reels/Shorts).



Hands-on AI Experience: You must be proficient in prompting for video and images using different tools.



Design Eye: Strong sense of composition, typography, and "premium" branding.



Industry Interest: You find construction, architecture, and "Before & After" transformations fascinating.



Reliability: You are a self-starter who can work independently and track hours.



What We Offer

Long-term collaboration.



Creative freedom to experiment with the latest AI tools.



Opportunity to move into a full-time lead creative role.



How to Apply

Portfolio: Send links to Reels or Ads you’ve created (especially AI-enhanced ones).



Loom Video: Include a 1–2 minute Loom video explaining your AI workflow and why you are the best fit for a construction-themed project.



Task: Briefly explain how you would make a "Construction Service Company in Dortmund" look viral using AI.

title: Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager (D2C E-commerce Coffee Brand) *Full Time | Remote (Asia Time Zone)
description:
Innovative global coffee brand inventing one-of-a-kind tools redefining how coffee is experienced. Seeking a Marketing Operator to own campaigns, launches, and cross-channel execution alongside founders.





ABOUT ICOSA BREWHOUSE:

ICOSA Brewhouse is a globally recognized specialty coffee brand redefining how coffee is experienced. We are shaping coffee culture around the world. (
  / 
 )



We design and invent one-of-a-kind tools that didn’t exist before — tools that elevate everyday rituals and introduce new ways of enjoying coffee.



From record-breaking Kickstarter launches to collaborations with world-class coffee professionals, our products are used by champions, in top cafés, and in homes in 100+ countries around the world. 



We are a design-led, innovation-driven brand operating in a niche we are actively shaping. We build thoughtfully, test deliberately, and care deeply about quality — in both product and execution.



As we continue to innovate, launch new products, and grow, we are looking for a Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager to take ownership of how our work is brought to life across channels.



You won’t just publish content.



You’ll help shape how new products are introduced, how campaigns are structured, and how our global community experiences our brand — while ensuring execution remains disciplined, consistent, and scalable.







YOUR ROLE AND OPPORTUNITY ON THE TEAM:

This is a senior marketing operator role. Execution is central — but it is not a junior content posting role.



You will work directly with our Marketing Lead to:

• Own day-to-day marketing delivery across core channels

• Structure and execute campaigns from planning through rollout

• Translate ideas into clear, executable briefs

• Coordinate creative production across internal, outsourced, and AI-assisted workflows

• Strengthen how our marketing engine operates over time



You will see early product prototypes.

You will contribute to campaign discussions before launch.

You will help shape how innovation is presented to a global audience.



Execution is central to this role — but so is judgment, ownership, and the ability to think in campaigns rather than isolated posts.





What you’ll own:



(1) Marketing Execution Across Channels

• Own social media execution (Instagram and
).

• Plan and manage content calendars aligned with brand positioning.

• Ensure consistent publishing and follow-through across platforms.

• Manage inbox and community engagement, including partnership or influencer communication if required.

• Execute
 campaigns aligned with launches, promotions, and collaborations.



You ensure marketing execution remains structured, timely, and dependable.



(2) Campaign Rollout & Launch Execution

• Support and execute seasonal campaigns, product launches, collaborations, and promotional initiatives.

• Translate marketing objectives into structured creative briefs.

• Coordinate creative asset development across designers, freelancers, and AI-supported workflows.

• Oversee cohesive cross-channel rollout so messaging, visuals, and timing align across social,
, and paid efforts.

• Strengthen campaign structure and rollout processes over time.



You think in campaigns — not just content pieces.



(3) Creative Briefing & Quality Control

• Create clear, structured briefs for design and content production.

• Maintain high standards of aesthetic consistency, messaging clarity, and brand voice integrity across both human and AI-assisted workflows.

• Draft copy or guide AI-assisted content creation when needed, ensuring outputs remain on-brand and high quality.

• Review creative outputs for brand alignment before escalation to the Marketing Lead.

• Collaborate comfortably in tools such as Figma or similar platforms to support execution and alignment.



You don’t need to be a designer — but you should have strong creative judgment.



(4) Growth & Operational Development

• Identify opportunities to refine workflows and strengthen how our marketing engine operates.

• Lead or contribute to structured testing and rollout of new channels or initiatives as capacity allows.

• Over time, take increasing ownership of campaign structuring, cross-channel coordination, partnership campaign oversight, and creative alignment across performance-driven efforts.



As you demonstrate reliability and judgment, your scope expands meaningfully.





What success looks like:

• Social and
 channels operate smoothly with consistent execution and strong brand alignment.

• Campaigns are rolled out in a coordinated, cross-channel manner without last-minute chaos.

• Creative briefs are structured, clear, and reduce friction across collaborators.

• Marketing execution no longer bottlenecks leadership attention.

• Early experiments in new channels or initiatives are tested in a structured way.



Over time, you become a trusted execution leader within the marketing team.





What This Role Is Not:

• Not a pure content creator role.

• Not a brand strategist role.

• Not a paid media buyer role.

• Not an administrative coordinator role.



This is a senior marketing operator position inside a growing global brand.







ABOUT YOU / WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

You are someone who:

• Understands how structured marketing campaigns come together.

• Can translate ideas into clear execution plans.

• Is comfortable owning delivery without hand-holding.

• Is comfortable reviewing performance data and using insights to inform execution decisions.

• Is strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



You are strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



Must have skills or experience:

• 4–6+ years of experience managing marketing and/or social for a brand.

• Experience executing structured marketing campaigns.

• Experience within D2C or product-based brands strongly preferred.

• Comfortable operating inside e-commerce environments.

• Highly detail-oriented and disciplined in follow-through.

• Strong creative judgment and ability to assess content quality and brand alignment.

• Comfort collaborating in design tools such as Figma.

• Comfortable working directly with founders in a small, fast-moving team.



Big pluses:

• Experience supporting product launches or crowdfunding campaigns.

• Experience creating, implementing, and refining marketing processes or building SOPs.

• Experience coordinating freelancers or creative collaborators.

• Familiarity with Klaviyo or similar
 platforms.

• Exposure to AI-assisted marketing workflows.







WHY JOIN US:

At ICOSA Brewhouse, you will:

• Work directly with founders who are deeply involved in product design, positioning, and global campaigns.

• Operate close to innovation — seeing products and launches before they are introduced to the world.

• Contribute to campaigns that reach a global coffee audience.

• Have real ownership inside a small, high-performing team where your work is visible and impactful.

• Help shape coffee culture around the world.



We are a fully remote team — but we operate with structure and discipline.



You’ll be joining a close-knit group focused on building something meaningful with collaboration and accountability. There is no office politics. No unnecessary hierarchy. Just people committed to high standards.



We care deeply about growth — not just as a company, but as individuals. As we expand, there are real opportunities to take on broader ownership, lead initiatives, and shape how our marketing evolves.



If you want a role where:

• Your ideas are heard.

• Your execution matters.

• Your scope can grow with your capability.

You will feel at home here.







COMPENSATION AND WORKING STRUCTURE

Full time: 40 hours/week 

Compensation range: $1,100-$1,800 (based on relevant experience and demonstrated capability)

Up to 16 days of paid time off annually

Asia time zone working hours required







HOW TO APPLY

Are you ready? 



If you’d like to join us on our journey and grow together with us, we’re looking forward to meeting you.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our application process extremely efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Complete the quick application: 
 

2. In the first question of the application start it with: "I’m (insert your name) from (insert your city/town) and my favourite food is (insert your favourite food). Then introduce yourself and why you think you’ll be a good fit for this position. 

3. We’ll be in touch with next steps for the interview once we receive it. 



We look forward to reviewing your application.

title: B2B Cold Callers For HUGE COMMISSION ($200/Signup)

title: Sound Designer
description:
- Sound Designer -



Location: Remote (Philippines) / Project-Based

Duration: 4 Months

Level: Mid to Senior



About SS Production:

    SS Production is an audio house dedicated to crafting world-class auditory experiences for the global gaming industry. Our team has contributed to AAA titles, including Hitman, New World, and Star Wars. We are looking for a specialist who shares our passion for technical excellence and narrative immersion.



Role Overview:

    We are seeking a high-caliber Contract Sound Designer to craft world-class audio assets and manage narrative clarity through expert dialogue editing. You will be responsible for creating the "sonic weight" of the game—ensuring every sound effect is impactful and every line of dialogue is crystal clear within a complex acoustic environment.



Key Responsibilities:

• Asset Creation: Design and process original SFX (combat, movement, UI, and environmental) that meet AAA quality bars for texture, frequency balance, and dynamic range.

• Dialogue Editing: Perform surgical editing on raw voiceover (VO) files. This includes noise reduction (clicks, breaths, room tone), consistent leveling, and creative processing (e.g., world-izing, radio filters, or creature DSP).

• Cinematic Audio Design: Design linear audio for cutscenes and scripted sequences, focusing on emotional impact and narrative flow.

• Pipeline Discipline: Maintain rigorous naming conventions and metadata standards to ensure seamless hand-offs to the implementation team.





Required Skills & Qualifications:

• DAW Proficiency: Must be proficient in at least one of the following DAWs:

      - Reaper

      - Cubase / Nuendo

      - Pro Tools

• Audio Restoration: Knowledge of restoration suites (e.g., iZotope RX) for cleaning and polishing dialogue.



Preferred Skills:

• Middleware Implementation: Experience in Wwise or FMOD.

• Engine Integration: Experience working within Unreal Engine (Audio Blueprints/MetaSounds) or Unity.



Application Requirements:

1. Resume: Highlighting past experience in games, film, or any type of media.

2. Showreel: A link to your work.

title: Social Media & Email Conversion Specialist
description:
Hi! I'm Debbie, CEO of Pineway, an AI-powered platform helping coaches and consultants stop drowning in admin and start focusing on what they do best.



We have a growing, engaged audience, a warm waitlist of 700+ coaches ready to hear from us, and content that's already working organically. Now we need someone to help us convert that momentum into our first paying customers.



If you know how to turn social content and
 into real revenue, I'd love to meet you!



WHAT YOU'LL OWN



You'll work closely with our content intern, who already handles community engagement, DMs, and brainstorming. We want you to help elevate what we're already doing and drive it toward one outcome: paying customers.



Content & Scripts

- Own the full content calendar across Instagram, TikTok and LinkedIn

- Transform my ideas (and yours too!) into conversion-focused scripts and captions

- Write hooks that stop the scroll AND drive action

- Ensure consistent, high-quality content is published every week

- Bring fresh content ideas proactively and don't wait to be asked



Conversion & Sales

- Every piece of content serves one goal: move people closer to buying

- Track what drives profile visits, link clicks, and signups

- Identify what's converting and systematize it

- Collaborate with our content intern on engagement and community




 Marketing

- Write and send weekly nurture
s to our waitlist

- Build simple sequences that move cold leads toward paying customers

- A/B test subject lines and CTAs

- Report on open rates, clicks, and conversions



Performance & Reporting

- Weekly report: what was published, what was performed, what converted

- Bring recommendations, not just data

- Help us understand what to scale and what to cut



SUCCESS METRICS:



Month 1: Content calendar live, consistent posting rhythm established, first
 sequence running



Month 3: Content directly attributable to waitlist signups and customer conversations,
 open rates above 40%



Month 6: Clear, repeatable content-to-revenue pipeline with paying customers coming through social and
 consistently



MUST HAVE:

- 2-4 years managing social media content with proven conversion results

- Experience helping an early-stage product get its first paying customers

- Strong scriptwriting: you can write in someone else's voice naturally

-
 marketing experience with real metrics to back it up

- Excellent written English: warm, direct, compelling

- Self-directed: you bring the energy, you don't wait for it



You're NOT a fit if:

- Your portfolio is full of views and followers, but no revenue impact

- You've only worked with big budgets at large agencies

- You need a detailed brief for every piece of content

- You can't show us what your work made someone do



What You'll Get:

- $1,500-2,000 USD/month with raises tied to revenue milestones

- Fully remote work

- Work directly with the founding team — no layers, fast decisions

- Early equity in a pre-revenue startup with real traction — available when you transition to full-time.

- A front-row seat to building something incredible from the ground up



HOW TO APPLY:



If you've read this far, here's what I'm looking to see:



1. Record & attach a Loom video (3 minutes max) covering:

- Who you are and what you've worked on

- What's interesting or exciting about working with our tiny team

- One specific example where your content drove someone to buy something - feel free tell us the numbers and brag a little!

- How you'd approach converting Pineway's 700-person waitlist into paying customers



2. Write 3 hooks for this Instagram Reel topic: "Why coaches are losing clients because of their tools" (visit 
 first)



3. Write the opening paragraph of a re-engagement
 to 700 coaches who signed up for a waitlist but haven't heard from us in a while



I read every single application and will respond to every single one. I can't wait to hear from you!

title: Remote Bookkeeper
description:
Remote Bookkeeper – Commercial Construction (Xero | Procore preferred)



• Remote / work-from-home 

• Bookkeeping + construction admin (payment claims, retentions, supplier/subbie processing)

• Xero essential | Procore experience highly regarded (training provided)

• Thursdays are mandatory (payroll/payday processing day – AEST)



About Us

Summit Building Co. is a commercial carpentry contractor based in Geelong, Victoria. We’re growing quickly and tightening our systems, reporting, and cost control. We’re looking for a reliable, detail-obsessed bookkeeper who understands how construction businesses actually run — and can keep our accounts, claims and reconciliations tight and on time.



About the Role

This is a remote position focused primarily on bookkeeping and construction finance administration. You’ll work closely with the Directors and our project team to ensure purchase orders, supplier invoices, subcontractor claims, payroll, and payment claims are processed accurately and reconciled properly.



You don’t need to be in our office — but you do need to be highly organised, proactive, and confident working independently with clear communication.



Key Responsibilities (include but not limited to)



Construction bookkeeping & project cost admin

• Maintain clean, accurate records in Xero (coding, reconciliations, supplier statements, BAS prep support)

• Import and allocate direct costs to the correct job/cost code

• Process purchase orders, supplier invoices, and supplier payment runs

• Process subcontractor payment claims (check against scopes/POs, variations, required docs)

• Track and calculate retention (held + released) for head contract and subcontractors

• Reconcile remittance advices and resolve invoice/payment discrepancies

• Assist with payment claims: prepare/compile claim support, then adjust claims once the builder issues a payment schedule (including retentions/offsets)



Payroll & compliance

• Payroll processing and checks (timesheets, allowances as applicable)

• Superannuation processing and reporting

• Manage relevant industry obligations (e.g., CoINVEST where applicable)



Systems & communication

• Maintain consistent filing and document control (invoicing, POs, payment schedules, compliance docs)

• Use (or learn) Procore for cost tracking/workflows and supporting documentation

• Provide weekly summaries: what’s billed, what’s outstanding, what’s due, retention position, and key issues



What You Bring



Must-have

• Proven bookkeeping experience (construction/trades strongly preferred)

• Xero proficiency is essential

• Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

• High attention to detail + ability to self-manage and hit deadlines

• Strong written communication (you’ll be liaising remotely)



Nice-to-have

• Procore experience (or other construction PM platforms)

• Familiarity with commercial construction workflows: progress claims, payment schedules, retentions, variations, supplier/subbie processing



Working Arrangement

• Remote (work-from-home)

• Starting workload: ~15–25 hours/week, with the opportunity to increase as you prove capability (and as our workload grows)

• You must have a reliable internet connection and a suitable home setup

• Overlap with AEST business hours is required for communication (e.g., at least 2–3 hours/day overlap)

• Thursdays are non-negotiable — you must be available every Thursday (AEST) to complete payroll/payday processing



How to Apply (important — filters fast)

Please include a short cover letter answering:



What construction bookkeeping tasks have you done (payment claims, payment schedules, retentions, subbie claims, supplier reconciliations)?



What systems have you used (Xero + any construction software like Procore)?



Tell us about a time you improved a bookkeeping/process system in a business.



Applications without these answers won’t be considered.

Ongoing engagement & community interaction



???? Skills Required

title: TELEGRAM MARKETING & COPYWRITING SPECIALIST - Trading Signals & Algo Business
description:
About Us



We're a fast-growing trading education and signals company helping traders worldwide achieve consistent profits through our premium signals, algorithms, and coaching programs. Our
 community is our primary sales engine, and we're looking for a marketing powerhouse to drive conversions and keep our members engaged.



Important: No AI-generated copy

This role must be done without AI writing tools (ChatGPT/etc.). We will test for this. If you rely on AI to write your copy, DO NOT REPLY.



The Role



You will be the voice of our brand inside our Free and Premium
 groups. This is not a “post and ghost” position. You will actively drive sales, nurture leads, and increase revenue through daily conversion-focused messaging.



Responsibilities

• Drive front-end conversions: convert free members into premium clients through persuasive messaging, proof, stories, trade updates, and strategic offers

• Maximize upsells: promote coaching, exclusive signal groups, algorithms, and premium products to existing members

• Content creation: write high-converting
 posts, create simple visuals, and script short videos (no editing required)

• Trade communication: share updates from our trading team, build excitement around wins, and maintain engagement during the London session

• Community 
ntum: keep both groups active, engaged, and primed for conversions throughout the day



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

• Strong English copywriting skills (you know hooks, proof, urgency, CTA)

• Trading knowledge: you understand MT4/MT5 and can speak trader language authentically

• Sales mindset: comfortable selling, handling objections, and driving action through messaging

• Self-starter: organized, consistent, and able to execute without hand-holding

• Availability: London Open to London Close (approximately 8am–4pm UK time)

• Schedule: 7 days/week coverage (may evolve into a 2-person structure later)

• No AI writing: original, human copy only



Bonus Points

• Experience marketing forex/crypto signals or trading education products

• CPA/affiliate marketing experience

• Proven track record of increasing conversions through

• Understanding of trading education business models (funnels, objections, upsells)



Compensation

• $700–$1,400/month (based on hours and performance)

• Performance bonuses tied to conversions and upsells (discussed after trial)

• Long-term opportunity with growth into leadership if you perform



Work Details

• 100% Remote

• Full-time, long-term

• 40+ hours/week

• Coverage primarily during the London trading session



To Apply (Must Send + Must Answer)

• Share 3–5 examples of your best
 posts or marketing copy (links/screenshots).

• In 5–10 sentences, describe your MT4/MT5 + trading/market knowledge.

• In 5–10 sentences, explain why you’re the right person to run
 as a conversion engine (no generic answers).

• Confirm your weekly availability in UK time, including weekends.

• Write a
 promo message (120–180 words) selling a premium signals membership using hook + proof + urgency + CTA (must be original, no AI).

• Explicitly confirm you can do this role without AI-generated writing.



IMPORTANT: DO NOT REPLY IF:

• You rely on AI tools to write your copy, we can tell and we will test for it

• You have no understanding of trading/forex/crypto markets

• You’re looking for an “easy posting” job with minimal responsibility

• You can’t handle the London trading hours schedule consistently



This role is for closers//marketers who understand sales psychology and want to be the driving force behind a growing trading business.

mbers who want to develop their skills and grow with us as the company continues to expand.

I WILL NOT TAKE IT SERIOUSLY AND YOU WILL NOT RECEIVE A RESPONSE. ONLY APPLY IF YOU HAVE PROVEN, PRACTICAL FOREX EXPERIENCE AND YOU’RE COMFORTABLE WITH CONSISTENT, PERFORMANCE-DRIVEN WORK.

title: Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager (D2C E-commerce Coffee Brand) *Full Time | Remote (Asia Time Zone)
description:
Innovative global coffee brand inventing one-of-a-kind tools redefining how coffee is experienced. Seeking a Marketing Operator to own campaigns, launches, and cross-channel execution alongside founders.





ABOUT ICOSA BREWHOUSE:

ICOSA Brewhouse is a globally recognized specialty coffee brand redefining how coffee is experienced. We are shaping coffee culture around the world. (
  / 
 )



We design and invent one-of-a-kind tools that didn’t exist before — tools that elevate everyday rituals and introduce new ways of enjoying coffee.



From record-breaking Kickstarter launches to collaborations with world-class coffee professionals, our products are used by champions, in top cafés, and in homes in 100+ countries around the world. 



We are a design-led, innovation-driven brand operating in a niche we are actively shaping. We build thoughtfully, test deliberately, and care deeply about quality — in both product and execution.



As we continue to innovate, launch new products, and grow, we are looking for a Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager to take ownership of how our work is brought to life across channels.



You won’t just publish content.



You’ll help shape how new products are introduced, how campaigns are structured, and how our global community experiences our brand — while ensuring execution remains disciplined, consistent, and scalable.







YOUR ROLE AND OPPORTUNITY ON THE TEAM:

This is a senior marketing operator role. Execution is central — but it is not a junior content posting role.



You will work directly with our Marketing Lead to:

• Own day-to-day marketing delivery across core channels

• Structure and execute campaigns from planning through rollout

• Translate ideas into clear, executable briefs

• Coordinate creative production across internal, outsourced, and AI-assisted workflows

• Strengthen how our marketing engine operates over time



You will see early product prototypes.

You will contribute to campaign discussions before launch.

You will help shape how innovation is presented to a global audience.



Execution is central to this role — but so is judgment, ownership, and the ability to think in campaigns rather than isolated posts.





What you’ll own:



(1) Marketing Execution Across Channels

• Own social media execution (Instagram and
).

• Plan and manage content calendars aligned with brand positioning.

• Ensure consistent publishing and follow-through across platforms.

• Manage inbox and community engagement, including partnership or influencer communication if required.

• Execute
 campaigns aligned with launches, promotions, and collaborations.



You ensure marketing execution remains structured, timely, and dependable.



(2) Campaign Rollout & Launch Execution

• Support and execute seasonal campaigns, product launches, collaborations, and promotional initiatives.

• Translate marketing objectives into structured creative briefs.

• Coordinate creative asset development across designers, freelancers, and AI-supported workflows.

• Oversee cohesive cross-channel rollout so messaging, visuals, and timing align across social,
, and paid efforts.

• Strengthen campaign structure and rollout processes over time.



You think in campaigns — not just content pieces.



(3) Creative Briefing & Quality Control

• Create clear, structured briefs for design and content production.

• Maintain high standards of aesthetic consistency, messaging clarity, and brand voice integrity across both human and AI-assisted workflows.

• Draft copy or guide AI-assisted content creation when needed, ensuring outputs remain on-brand and high quality.

• Review creative outputs for brand alignment before escalation to the Marketing Lead.

• Collaborate comfortably in tools such as Figma or similar platforms to support execution and alignment.



You don’t need to be a designer — but you should have strong creative judgment.



(4) Growth & Operational Development

• Identify opportunities to refine workflows and strengthen how our marketing engine operates.

• Lead or contribute to structured testing and rollout of new channels or initiatives as capacity allows.

• Over time, take increasing ownership of campaign structuring, cross-channel coordination, partnership campaign oversight, and creative alignment across performance-driven efforts.



As you demonstrate reliability and judgment, your scope expands meaningfully.





What success looks like:

• Social and
 channels operate smoothly with consistent execution and strong brand alignment.

• Campaigns are rolled out in a coordinated, cross-channel manner without last-minute chaos.

• Creative briefs are structured, clear, and reduce friction across collaborators.

• Marketing execution no longer bottlenecks leadership attention.

• Early experiments in new channels or initiatives are tested in a structured way.



Over time, you become a trusted execution leader within the marketing team.





What This Role Is Not:

• Not a pure content creator role.

• Not a brand strategist role.

• Not a paid media buyer role.

• Not an administrative coordinator role.



This is a senior marketing operator position inside a growing global brand.







ABOUT YOU / WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

You are someone who:

• Understands how structured marketing campaigns come together.

• Can translate ideas into clear execution plans.

• Is comfortable owning delivery without hand-holding.

• Is comfortable reviewing performance data and using insights to inform execution decisions.

• Is strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



You are strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



Must have skills or experience:

• 4–6+ years of experience managing marketing and/or social for a brand.

• Experience executing structured marketing campaigns.

• Experience within D2C or product-based brands strongly preferred.

• Comfortable operating inside e-commerce environments.

• Highly detail-oriented and disciplined in follow-through.

• Strong creative judgment and ability to assess content quality and brand alignment.

• Comfort collaborating in design tools such as Figma.

• Comfortable working directly with founders in a small, fast-moving team.



Big pluses:

• Experience supporting product launches or crowdfunding campaigns.

• Experience creating, implementing, and refining marketing processes or building SOPs.

• Experience coordinating freelancers or creative collaborators.

• Familiarity with Klaviyo or similar
 platforms.

• Exposure to AI-assisted marketing workflows.







WHY JOIN US:

At ICOSA Brewhouse, you will:

• Work directly with founders who are deeply involved in product design, positioning, and global campaigns.

• Operate close to innovation — seeing products and launches before they are introduced to the world.

• Contribute to campaigns that reach a global coffee audience.

• Have real ownership inside a small, high-performing team where your work is visible and impactful.

• Help shape coffee culture around the world.



We are a fully remote team — but we operate with structure and discipline.



You’ll be joining a close-knit group focused on building something meaningful with collaboration and accountability. There is no office politics. No unnecessary hierarchy. Just people committed to high standards.



We care deeply about growth — not just as a company, but as individuals. As we expand, there are real opportunities to take on broader ownership, lead initiatives, and shape how our marketing evolves.



If you want a role where:

• Your ideas are heard.

• Your execution matters.

• Your scope can grow with your capability.

You will feel at home here.







COMPENSATION AND WORKING STRUCTURE

Full time: 40 hours/week 

Compensation range: $1,100-$1,800 (based on relevant experience and demonstrated capability)

Up to 16 days of paid time off annually

Asia time zone working hours required







HOW TO APPLY

Are you ready? 



If you’d like to join us on our journey and grow together with us, we’re looking forward to meeting you.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our application process extremely efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Complete the quick application: 
 

2. In the first question of the application start it with: "I’m (insert your name) from (insert your city/town) and my favourite food is (insert your favourite food). Then introduce yourself and why you think you’ll be a good fit for this position. 

3. We’ll be in touch with next steps for the interview once we receive it. 



We look forward to reviewing your application.

title: AI Integration Engineer
description:
Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-Time

Schedule: 8 hours per day. The first 4 hours are flexible, but employees must be available during the mandatory 4PM–8PM (PH Time) overlap period.



Company Overview:

We are a leading Amazon brand aggregator operating in the U.S., Canada, the U.K., and across the EU. Our mission is to acquire, scale, and optimize e-commerce brands, transforming them into market leaders. We leverage expertise in product development, creative design, data analytics, supply chain management, and PPC strategy to ensure our brands outperform the competition. With a data-driven mindset, cutting-edge technology, and a culture of innovation, we continuously push boundaries to create best-in-class brands that thrive in the ever-evolving e-commerce landscape.



About the Role: 

We are seeking an AI Integration Engineer to join our team as a technical "multiplier." This role is not just about writing code; it is about strategically embedding Artificial Intelligence into our unique, custom-built ecosystem. You will complement our Automations Team by acting as the bridge between raw AI capabilities and our production environment.



Key Responsibilities

Build and optimize connections between internal APIs (NodeJS) and AI models/data scripts (Python).

Act as the "go-to" expert for the staff, translating business problems into AI solutions and teaching non-technical team members how to use AI tools effectively.

Develop, test, and version-control prompts and RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) pipelines to ensure output quality.

Monitor AI latency, token usage/costs, and error rates, providing weekly optimization reports.

Maintain a clear internal "AI Wiki" that documents how our AI integrations work and how staff can leverage them.

2. Required Experience & Skills

Technical Expertise

3+ years in NodeJS (handling async requests, promises, and middleware) and Python (specifically for data processing, Pandas, and OpenAI/LangChain libraries).

Expert-level knowledge of HTTP/REST, Webhooks, and handling non-deterministic JSON outputs from LLMs.

Ability to independently audit API documentation to determine technical feasibility, rate limits, and authentication requirements for new automation requests.

Familiarity with GitHub/GitLab, Docker, and basic cloud deployment (AWS/Heroku/Vercel).

Educational & Advisory Skills

Ability to create short "Loom" tutorials or documentation for staff training.

Ability to look at a manual process and determine if it’s a "Rule-based Automation" problem or an "AI" problem.

Security & Ethics

Understands why we don't put sensitive customer data into public AI prompts and knows how to implement PII (Personally Identifiable Information) scrubbing.

A dedicated, private workspace and a commitment to using VPNs and Password Managers (LastPass/1Pass).

Must-Have Personal Assets (for remote/VA setup)

Dedicated home office setup with a high-performance laptop/desktop.

Stable high-speed internet connection (minimum 20 Mbps, with backup preferred).

At minimum: Intel Core i5 (10th Gen or newer) / AMD Ryzen 5, 16 GB RAM, 512 GB storage.





Benefits

12 days annual leave (convertible to cash)

Paid Philippine holidays (9 days a year)

Birthday leave

Bonuses & profit-sharing opportunities

HMO coverage upon completion of probation

Local & international trips for team building and brand immersion

Continuous learning: 4 hours of company-sponsored education weekly

Stock option shares for long-term contributors

title: E-commerce Marketplace Growth Lead/manager (bol.com / NL)
description:

About Onebird

Onebird is a Dutch marketplace e-commerce company selling exclusively on 
. We operate multiple fast-growing brands and generate millions in annual revenue.



Our ambition: become a top 5 seller on 
 within 3 years by building a scalable and dominant marketplace structure.



We are not looking for a typical manager. We are looking for a builder.



The role

As Marketplace Growth Lead, you are responsible for the growth and performance of our 
 business. You work directly with the CEO and focus on revenue, ranking, and conversion.



You are hands-on, data-driven, and fast in execution. You see opportunities, test quickly, and scale what works.

Focus: everything you do must increase 
 revenue. No distractions. No D2C or webshop initiatives.

This role is designed as a path toward Head of Growth.



Phase 1 – First 90 days

You go deep into the operation and fully understand how our business and 
 work.



You will work closely with CX and analyze:

- Reviews and return data

- Pricing and promotions

- Conversion and ranking

- Advertising (with our PPC partner)



You build a strong foundation:

- Review and rating improvement

- CX processes and structure

- KPI dashboards and weekly scorecards

- Quick wins on listings and pricing



At the same time, you test new growth opportunities such as:

- Influencer and affiliate strategies

- Visibility and relevance improvements

- Review velocity and ranking growth



Your goal: identify the highest leverage growth drivers and execute fast.



Phase 2 – Scale

Once the foundation is in place:



- Optimize pricing, promotions, and campaigns

- Work with PPC and external partners

- Improve systems and processes

- Help build the commercial structure

- Grow into a leadership role



What you will do

- Analyze and optimize marketplace performance

- Develop pricing and promotion strategies

- Improve listings and conversion

- Accelerate reviews and ratings

- Turn returns and refund data into actions

- Build KPI dashboards and reporting

- Work with external partners

- Translate data into execution

- No overanalysis. Focus on leverage.





What you get

- Direct collaboration with the CEO

- High autonomy and ownership

- Budget and freedom to test

- Collaboration with experienced partners

- Clear growth path toward Head of Growth

- Performance bonus based on results

- EU work schedule (no graveyard shifts)



Who you are

- 4–7 years marketplace experience (Amazon, Shopee, Lazada, Walmart, 
 or similar)

- Strong in data and commercial decision-making

- Hands-on and execution-focused

- You build systems and processes

- You think in growth, not tasks

- You take ownership and responsibility

- 
 experience is a plus but not required.



How to apply (5 minutes)

No long cover letter needed.



Send:

Link to your CV or LinkedIn

3 short bullets:

- Biggest marketplace growth you achieved (+% and timeframe)

- One system or process you built (pricing, reviews, dashboards, etc.)

- One problem you solved using data (returns, conversion, ranking, etc.)



If you want to build, scale, and grow instead of just manage, we’d love to hear from you.

You will fully own our organic social media presence on Instagram and TikTok.

This means you are responsible for planning, posting, captions, stories, community management (DMs & comments), and daily execution.



This is NOT just scheduling content.

We are looking for someone who can run our social media channels independently and consistently.



Your Weekly Tasks

- Post 1–2 times per day on Instagram & TikTok

- Create strong captions & CTAs (engaging, on-brand, conversion-focused)

- Post daily stories (product usage, UGC, behind the scenes, promos)

- Reply to DMs & comments within 24 hours

- Plan and manage the content calendar

- Repurpose existing videos into social posts

- Coordinate with video editors & creative team

- Track basic performance (views, engagement) and report weekly



We Are Looking For Someone Who

- Has proven experience managing Instagram & TikTok for brands

- Understands short-form content and social media trends

- Can work independently without daily hand-holding

- Is proactive: asks questions if something is unclear

- Is highly organized and consistent with daily posting

- Understands brand tone and can adapt copy per platform



Important (Read Carefully – This Filters Out 90% of Bad Applicants)

We post daily. This role requires consistency and ownership.

If you:

- Miss posting deadlines

- Are inconsistent

- Don’t reply to DMs/comments on time

- Don’t ask questions when confused

- Or treat this as “just scheduling posts”



This will clearly not be a fit.



Paid Test Task (Mandatory)

Before we hire you, we will ask you to complete a paid test task:

- Create a 7-day content plan

- Write captions for 5 posts

- Propose story ideas

This helps both sides see if we’re a good match.



Long-Term Opportunity

If this works well, this can become a long-term collaboration with consistent work, growing responsibility, and higher pay over time.

title: Video Editor for Paid Ads (Meta, TikTok, UGC, D2C Brand)
description:
About Us

Ace & Taylor is a fast-growing D2C e-commerce brand selling premium hair tools across Europe. We focus on high-performing direct response video ads for Meta 
/Instagram) and TikTok.



We work with a creative engine: every week our creators produce raw content, and we test multiple variations to find winners. We are currently active in The Netherlands and Belgium and expanding across Europe.



What You’ll Do (Your Core Responsibility)

You will be our dedicated Video Editor for performance ads. Your job is to turn raw creator content into multiple high-converting ad variations for Meta & TikTok on a weekly basis.



This is NOT basic video editing.

We are looking for someone who understands direct response marketing and knows how to edit videos that convert.



Your Weekly Tasks

- Edit 5–15 short-form ad videos per week (UGC + lifestyle + product demos)

- Create multiple variations from the same raw footage (different hooks, captions, pacing, first 3 seconds, CTAs)

- Add subtitles optimized for TikTok & Meta (fast, bold, attention-grabbing)

- Cut for retention: strong hooks in the first 1–3 seconds

- Follow our creative briefs, examples, and SOP

- Deliver on time every week

- Implement feedback and iterate on winning creatives

- Organize files properly (naming, folders, versions)



We Are Looking For Someone Who

- Has experience editing direct response / performance ads

- Understands how ads work on Meta & TikTok (hooks, pacing, scroll-stopping edits)

- Is detail-oriented and follows instructions carefully

- Is proactive: asks questions if something is unclear

- Can work independently once the SOP is clear

- Can handle weekly production without reminders



Important

We work fast and test a lot of creatives.

If you:

- Miss deadlines

- Don’t follow instructions

- Don’t ask questions when confused

- Or deliver inconsistent quality



This will clearly not be a fit.



Paid Test Task (Mandatory)

Before we hire you, we will ask you to complete a small paid test assignment (1–2 short ad videos) based on real raw footage and a clear briefing.

This helps both sides see if we’re a good match.



Long-Term Opportunity

If this works well, this can become a long-term collaboration with consistent weekly work, growth in responsibility, and higher pay over time.

title: Senior Graphic Designer (with Motion Graphics and UGC Editing) - Contract, Project-Based Opportunity
description:

 (Meta) and Google ads,
, and SMS.



What We Are Looking For: We are on the lookout for a talented Senior Graphic Designer with skills in Motion Graphics and UGC Editing to join our team on a project-based, contract basis. This role offers a consistent freelancing opportunity for a creative professional with a strong artistic flair, a knack for producing engaging visuals, and a passion for digital storytelling, specifically for paid media 
 ads, Instagram ads) ad campaigns.



Key Qualifications:



-5+ years of experience in graphic design, motion graphics, and UGC editing.



-UGC editing experience of 1+ years.

Strong portfolio showcasing your design skills, including examples of animations, transitions, UGC editing, and static ad designs made for paid social 
 ads, Instagram ads, and organic content).



-A link to your portfolio is required for consideration.



-Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, Premiere Pro), Figma, and Canva.



-Proficiency in English and excellent communication skills.

Fast turnaround times and a commitment to meeting project deadlines.



-Ability to work collaboratively within a virtual team environment, including regular communication via Slack and
.



-Willingness to participate in a video Zoom interview.

Responsibilities:



-Content Creation: Design and produce engaging motion graphics and animations that align with the brand's identity and campaign goals. This includes creating graphics for paid media ad campaigns on platforms like
 (Meta) and Google, focusing on short-form ads between 5-40 seconds.



-UGC Ads Cutting: Cut 
 ads for
 (Meta), Instagram, and TikTok, ensuring high-quality, engaging storytelling and visual appeal.

Static Design: Create static graphics for social media platforms, including
 (Meta), and Instagram.



-Ad Framing & Structure: Design content within frames such as Us vs. Them, Before & After, Bullet Points, Features/Benefits Point-Out, and UGC (User-Generated Content).



-Collaboration: Work closely with the marketing team to develop and implement visual campaigns, promotions, and product launches.



-Brand Consistency: Develop and maintain a consistent visual brand identity across all social media platforms, ensuring all designs are consistent with the brand’s style, voice, and goals.



-Trend & Pattern Awareness: Stay updated with the latest ad trends, patterns, and UGC trends to ensure the content remains relevant and innovative.



-Meeting Deadlines: Work efficiently in a fast-paced environment, meeting tight deadlines without compromising quality.

What You’ll Bring:



-A proven track record of success in graphic design, motion graphics, and UGC editing, with a portfolio to back it up.



-Strong technical skills in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, and Canva.

A keen eye for design and a deep understanding of digital marketing ad trends and patterns across Meta, Instagram, and TikTok.



-An ability to work efficiently on a freelance basis, meeting deadlines and communicating effectively throughout each project.



-Strong creative and artistic skills to translate concepts and ideas into engaging and dynamic visual content.



-Knowledge of different social media platforms and the types of content that perform well on each.



-Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with the content team and stakeholders.

-Keen attention to detail to ensure the quality of all visual elements and adherence to brand guidelines.

What You’ll Get:



The opportunity to work with Paul Klebanov Marketing and be part of a team that’s passionate about e-commerce growth and digital marketing.

Competitive compensation on a project-based, contract basis.

The flexibility to work remotely on a schedule that fits your lifestyle, provided you have reliable WiFi and a suitable workspace.

A Path to Full-Time Opportunity:



At Paul Klebanov Marketing, we're not just looking for immediate results—we're building a team that grows with us over the long term. While this position begins as a project-based, contract role, we are interested in finding a Senior Graphic Designer who can grow into a more permanent part of our team. For the right candidate, demonstrating exceptional skill, dedication, and a strong alignment with our agency’s values and goals, there will be the opportunity to transition into a full-time role. If you are ambitious, committed, and looking to not just work on exciting projects but also build a career, Paul Klebanov Marketing offers the supportive environment and opportunities for advancement that can help turn your professional aspirations into reality.

Equal Employment Opportunity:
