title: SEO Strategist & Account Manager
description:
Hawk IQ is a U.S.-based digital marketing agency that helps small businesses grow smarter and faster through data-driven SEO strategies, website optimization, AI Visibility (GEO) and Google Business Profile (GBP) management. We work with the Go High Level (GHL) CRM platform. We focus on clients needing Websites, CRM, Content Creation, Local & AI Visibility. 



We are expanding our remote team in the Philippines.



ROLE OVERVIEW:

We are hiring a proactive leader and skilled SEO Strategist to join our team. This role combines local Search Engine Optimization & AI strategy experience, client management, and continuous learning.



Initial responsibilities will require account management until revenues require an account manager. This role, with the right leadership skills, will have the opportunity to build a team and be responsible for its growth and profitability. The ideal candidate will be compensated well for that work. 



RESPONSIBILITIES:

 - Optimize Client Google Business Profiles (GBP) & AI Visibility (AIO / GEO) 

 - Conduct SEO audits, KW research, and competitor analysis for prospective clients

 - Implement on-page, off-page, and technical SEO strategies

 - Create backlinks and manage link-building campaigns

 - Manage and oversee SEO-friendly content

 - Coordinate client campaigns and reporting

 - Proactively stay updated on SEO and Google algorithm changes



QUALIFICATIONS:

- 2+ years SEO experience (small business preferred)

 - Strong knowledge of GBP optimization, on-page & off-page SEO

 - Experience with SEO tools (GA4, GTM, GSC, SEMrush, Ahrefs, etc.)

 - Excellent English communication skills

 - Organized and able to manage multiple clients

 - Google Sheets, Docs & Go High Level CRM experience required 



COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:

 - First 30 days (Trial): $650 USD

 - 60–90 days (Advanced Trial): $850 USD

 - 90–180 days (Full Employment after performance of skills): $1,050 - $1,250 / month (QTR Bonus based on performance reviews) 

 - Long-term, remote position with growth opportunities

 - Flexible hours (must overlap some U.S. time)

 - Candidate responsible for own ongoing training and development



IMPORTANT REQUIREMENTS:

 - Must work exclusively for Hawk IQ (no other agency / freelance work allowed)

 - Reliable internet connection with backup

 - Full focus and dedication to Hawk IQ clients



WHY JOIN US?

Be part of a growing digital marketing agency where your skills directly impact small business success. If you prove your work and skill, you will be compensated above PH market rates. If you are ready to grow your career in Digital Marketing, help build a great team and earn a competitive salary, we want to hear from you!

title: Senior Bookkeeper *Superstar Only*
description:
We are looking for two experienced bookkeepers to join our finance team and take ownership of expense categorization, transaction reconciliation, accounts payable, and invoice processing across multiple legal entities.



The bookkeepers will work closely with the CFO, ensuring that all financial transactions are accurately recorded, categorized, and reconciled on a regular basis. This role is ideal for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable managing financial data across multiple platforms — including Xero, Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and our custom CRM.



Key Responsibilities

- Categorize all expenses and transactions in Xero, ensuring accurate classification for reporting and compliance

- Reconcile transactions across multiple payment platforms, including Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRM tools

- Manage accounts payable, ensuring all invoices are properly reviewed, recorded, and scheduled for payment

- Assist with invoice processing, ensuring all vendor invoices are accurately documented and match purchase orders where applicable

- Work closely with the CFO to provide up-to-date financial records for monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting

- Ensure all financial data is accurate and properly organized to support compliance across multiple jurisdictions

- Flag discrepancies or unusual transactions for review by the CFO



What We’re Looking For

- At least 5 years of experience in bookkeeping and expense reconciliation

- Strong proficiency in Xero

- Experience working with Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRMs

- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

- Experience handling multi-entity, multi-currency financial data preferred

- Comfortable working in a remote-first environment

- Fluent in English, both written and spoken



Requirements for Effective Remote Work

- Reliable computer or laptop capable of photo and video editing

- Stable high-speed internet connection

- Conducive work environment



Working Schedule

- Full-time opportunity

- Remote work setup (Philippines-based applicants only)



Benefits

- Competitive pay

- Training and growth opportunities

- Opportunity to work with a fast-growing content-driven company



Salary range

- Php 40,000 - Php 65,000 (based on experience)



Application Instructions

Since this is a long-term position, there will be an in-depth qualification process. If you believe you have what it takes, here is what to do next:



Please go to the link below, review the questions carefully, and share the required information.






If you believe you meet our qualifications and requirements, we encourage you to apply now and become a valuable part of our rapidly expanding company.

title: Expat Relocation Coordinator
description:
Now Hiring: Expat Relocation Coordinator (Full-Time | P25,000 Starting Salary)

Help American expats relocate to the Philippines—be their right hand from touchdown to move-in.



About Us

The Savvy Expat is the #1 relocation service for Americans moving to the Philippines. From housing to healthcare, we handle every step of the relocation process so our clients don’t have to stress or get overcharged.



We’re looking for a Relocation Coordinator to join our team and become the bridge between foreign expats and life in the Philippines. This is a full-time, high-trust role for someone who is organized, takes initiative, and understands the ins and outs of local real estate and operations. Background and experience with real estate is required. 



What You’ll Do



Help expats find the right long-term condo or apartment in Metro Manila



Assist in lease negotiations and make sure clients get fair rental rates



Guide clients through opening bank accounts, securing visas, and enrolling in healthcare plans



Coordinate appointments and documents with immigration offices, banks, real estate brokers, and medical providers



Oversee airport pickup, onboarding, and move-in



Provide warm, professional communication via WhatsApp,
, and phone



Ensure a seamless experience from arrival to full relocation



Who We’re Looking For



- Must have real estate experience (at least 1 year in brokerage, leasing, or rentals)

- Must have a valid Philippine Real Estate License (PRC license)

- Speaks and writes fluent English (you’ll be client-facing with Americans)

- Naturally organized, detail-oriented, and process-driven

- Takes initiative without needing micromanagement

- Can juggle multiple clients, deadlines, and moving parts at once

- Comfortable working with high-trust, high-paying foreign clients

- Professional, presentable, and great at building relationships

- Familiar with Metro Manila real estate, especially BGC, Makati, and Pasig (a plus)

- Previous experience in hospitality, customer service, or client operations is a plus



Position Details

title: Performance Marketing Lead, Instagram
description:
Instagram Growth Owner — Creator-First Distribution | Performance-First Ownership

Full-time (40 hrs/week) · Remote · $1,200/month + Performance Bonuses



---



ABOUT US



We're a calorie-and-macro-tracking app that feels like taking notes. Type what you ate in plain English (like "eggs toast coffee") or snap a photo and let AI estimate your calories and macros. No database rabbit holes. No friction.



Our landing page: 



We're hiring one person to own Instagram end-to-end with a clear bar: you must be able to produce positive ROI within 10 days.



Important: This is not a "brand social" role. It's not about Meta ad spend. This role is built around a creator-first growth system and distribution multiplication across multiple accounts.



---



WHAT YOU'LL DO



You own all Instagram operations. Here's what that means:



1. Creator Engine (Acquisition)

- Source creators fast: fitness, meal prep, recipes, "what I eat," weight loss, gym niches

- Negotiate performance-based deals with minimal fixed fees and clear deliverables

- Manage quality: scripts, hooks, filming guidelines, edits, posting requirements

- Track outcomes via codes/links; maintain a clean pipeline in Sheets, Airtable, or Notion



2. Distribution Multiplication (Scaling)

- Take winning creator content and expand reach across owned accounts + partner pages

- Turn one winning concept into many variations: new hooks, captions, crops, CTAs

- Operate multiple themed accounts (recipes, meal prep, gym macros, etc.) with consistent cadence

- Stagger posts intelligently — avoid duplication spam and build compounding account trust



3. Creative Iteration (Speed)

- Ship new creatives fast: hooks, scripts, briefs, edits, re-cuts

- Build a "winner playbook" — when something hits, produce 10+ variations quickly

- Maintain a testing cadence that's relentless, measurable, and not vibes-based



4. Outbound Ops (Pipeline)

- Run IG DM and
 outreach to creators, communities, and distribution partners

- Build repeatable templates: outreach, follow-ups, negotiation, contracts, checklists

- Keep your tracker/CRM clean with clear statuses and next actions



---



THE 2 KPIs YOU'LL OWN



KPI #1: Day-10 Instagram Contribution ROI (cROI)

cROI = Instagram-attributed revenue ÷ Instagram total spend (creator costs, editing, tools, boosting if used). Target: break-even or better (cROI ? 1.0) by Day 10, then improve and scale.



KPI #2: Weekly Net-New Paying Subscribers from Instagram (NNPS-IG)

First-time paying subscribers attributed to Instagram via trackable links, codes, or landing pages. Target: grow week-over-week while maintaining KPI #1.



Note: iOS attribution is imperfect. You're expected to build measurement that's honest, consistent, and decision-useful.



---



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE IN YOUR FIRST 10 DAYS



- A creator pipeline producing consistent deal flow with negotiated terms and scheduled posts

- 10–20 creator videos in motion (live or scheduled) with tracking links/codes

- A functioning distribution network: multiple accounts posting variations, not identical duplicates

- Daily reporting loop: what shipped, what performed, what's being cut, what's being scaled

- At least one repeatable path to cROI ? 1.0 with a plan to scale without ROI collapsing



---



REQUIREMENTS



Must Have:

- Proven, revenue-accountable Instagram growth experience (creators + content systems + distribution)

- Strong fundamentals: hook writing, creative direction, offer positioning, conversion instincts

- Comfort operating under iOS attribution constraints without lying to yourself

- Operator mindset: you ship fast, measure honestly, iterate without a big team



Bonus Points:

- Mobile subscription growth experience (trial-to-paid, payback windows, churn/LTV thinking)

- UGC pipeline building (sourcing + scripting + editing workflow)

- Multi-account content distribution without destroying trust signals

- Strong taste in short-form content — you can feel what holds attention in the first 1–2 seconds



You Do NOT Need:

- Prior experience with a calorie/macro app specifically

- "Influencer marketing" as your only skill — this is an end-to-end growth system role



---



WHAT WE OFFER



- $1,200/month for ~40 hrs/week

- Performance bonuses tied directly to ROI and subscriber growth

- Payment via Wise (twice monthly)

- Shape company culture and growth systems from day one

- Collaborative Estonian team: regular syncs, high ownership, fast decisions

- Fully remote — flexible hours with some overlap for syncs



---



HOW TO APPLY



Start your application with the letter X, then answer these two questions:



1. A short note on how you'd get to positive ROI in 10 days using a creator-first distribution engine (no heavy reliance on paid ads).



2. 1–2 examples of creator-led growth systems you've run. Include: what you shipped, how you tracked results, and how you scaled winners. Link to an IG account you grew or a screenshot of campaign results if you have one.

title: Conversion Rate Optimization Specialist, Landing Pages
description:
About LUCYD:

At LUCYD, we’re transforming the world of digital advertising with a focus on wellness, sustainability, and social responsibility. We specialize in compliant advertising for CBD, cannabis, and DTC wellness brands, and we're not just selling products—we're creating positive impact through Conscious Compounds™.



We’re looking for a Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist, with a specific focus on landing pages, to join our marketing team. Your main role will be to design, optimize, and analyze landing pages that drive paid social ad performance and increase eCommerce conversions. Add the word "expedition" on your subject line to let us know you read the whole post.



Responsibilities:

Lead Landing Page Strategy: Own the landing page process—from wireframing to writing compelling copy and gathering visual assets

Collaborate with Designers & Developers: Ensure every page is visually stunning and built for high conversion

A/B Testing & Performance Analysis: Analyze data to continuously test and refine landing pages

Funnel Optimization: Audit the full eCommerce funnel and recommend improvements to boost performance



You MUST have the following qualifications:

3+ years of experience in CRO with focus on landing pages & eCommerce funnels

Proficient in Shopify, wireframing tools, and platforms like Unbounce, Leadpages, or similar

Strong analytical skills using Google Analytics, Hotjar, or similar tools

Excellent English communication skills (C1 Advanced level or Native)

Highly collaborative and detail-oriented

Must be available to work Eastern Time (EST/EDT) hours



If you believe you’re the right fit for this role, we’d love to hear from you. Send your portfolio, resume, and a short note about why you’re a great fit. Only applicants who follow all instructions and meet the qualifications will be considered.

We look forward to working with you!

title: Short-Form Video Editor for Viral Social Media Content (Instagram Reels / TikTok)
description:
We’re looking for a talented Short-Form Video Editor to help grow our brand OWNRSHP through high-quality, viral-style content.



OWNRSHP represents ambition, discipline, ownership, and self-belief. Your job will be to turn our raw lifestyle footage into engaging, motivational, and viral-ready videos for Instagram Reels and TikTok.



You’ll also edit inspirational clips and combine them with music, viral audio, and branding to create content that builds strong brand presence.



This role is perfect for someone who understands viral editing, hooks, pacing, and modern social media styles.





Responsibilities



• Edit raw lifestyle clips into engaging short-form content

• Create motivational / viral-style edits using music or trending audio

• Add strong hooks in the first seconds

• Include captions (sometimes), smooth cuts, and clean pacing

• Align videos with OWNRSHP’s premium, motivational brand style

• Add brand logo to final videos/carousel posts

• Bring creative ideas — not just follow instructions





Main Goal:

Create content that drives engagement, virality, and brand growth.



Requirements:

• Experience editing Instagram Reels / TikToks

• Strong understanding of viral editing structure

• Skilled in CapCut, or Premiere Pro, or Final Cut, or similar editing app.

• Good English comprehension

• Reliable internet and communication





Bonus

• Experience with lifestyle or fashion brands

• Familiarity with motivational content

• Creative mindset and idea generation



Compensation



• Pay based on experience (per video or hourly)

• Performance-based increases available







How to Apply (IMPORTANT)



Start your application with:

OWN



Recommended - Please Include:



1. Links to short-form videos you’ve edited



2. Short note explaining:

- The editing platform you use.

- Why you’re a good fit or providing a portfolio/videos that shows your work

title: Shopify & CheckoutChamp Developer
description:
We're looking for a developer who lives and breathes CheckoutChamp and Shopify.



---



What You'll Own



- Build and maintain all web pages, funnels, and checkout flows - in CheckoutChamp & Shopify

- Set up and configure CheckoutChamp's CRM platform: product settings, campaign settings, and integrations

- Code custom checkout experiences optimized for conversion and speed

- Ensure every page is responsive, fast-loading, and bug-free across all devices

- Code all Shopify pages/sections in JSON for ease of access inside the Shopify CMS

- Work alongside our design and strategy team to bring briefs to life—and push back when something doesn't make sense from a development perspective

- Maintain clean version control and documentation so nothing depends on tribal knowledge



---



Requirements



- 2+ years of hands-on experience with CheckoutChamp—setting up the platform, building funnels, and coding custom checkouts

- 2+ years working with Shopify stores

- Fluent in Liquid, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS

- Ability to code easily customizable sections in Shopify (using JSON)

- Experience coding checkout flows and CRM configurations in CheckoutChamp specifically

- Comfortable working asynchronously with a remote team across multiple timezones



---



This Is NOT For You If:



- You don't have real, hands-on experience with CheckoutChamp

- You can't create customizable sections in Shopify

- You're not responsive—we need someone who replies within hours, not days

- You're unorganized or regularly miss deadlines

- You see development as just "making things look good" rather than driving conversions

- You're not comfortable communicating with non-technical people



---



What We Offer



- Potential full-time remote position after trial period

- Work directly with a small, high-output team that’s growing fast

- One brand, one mission—no client juggling

- Opportunity to own and shape the entire technical infrastructure as the company scales



---

title: Senior Invoice & Cost Control Specialist (E-commerce / Dropshipping)
description:
We are a fast-scaling e-commerce company operating in the dropshipping space, currently generating between $500K – $1M per month in revenue. Due to our rapid growth, we are looking for a true A-player to take full ownership of invoice control, cost management, and financial accuracy across our supply chain.



This is not a basic admin role. We are looking for someone sharp, analytical, detail-obsessed, and commercially aware.



Your Responsibilities



Monitor and control all supplier invoices



Verify invoices against quotation sheets and agreed pricing



Accurately track and update Cost of Goods (COGs)



Ensure financial data is consistent and correctly reflected in our systems



Identify pricing discrepancies and negotiate or flag inconsistencies



Work closely with suppliers to lower product costs, especially for winning products



Maintain organized financial documentation and reporting



Continuously optimize margins through cost control initiatives



Who You Are



Highly detail-oriented and structured



Experienced in invoice checking, bookkeeping, or financial control (preferably in e-commerce or dropshipping)



Strong with spreadsheets (Excel / Google Sheets advanced level required)



Commercially minded — you understand margins, pricing, and profitability



Proactive and independent — you take ownership



Comfortable working in a high-revenue, fast-paced environment



Excellent communicator



We operate at scale, and mistakes in this role are costly. We expect precision, accountability, and initiative.



If you’re applying, start your application with the word strawberry so we know you read the full description carefully.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to grow with a serious e-commerce business and play a key role in protecting and increasing profitability.



If you believe you are an A-player and ready to operate at a high level, we would love to hear from you.



Kind regards,

Joel Rondhuis

title: Senior Supply Chain Manager (SCM) & Parcel Panel Controller (PPC)
description:
Senior Supply Chain Manager (SCM) & Parcel Panel Controller (PPC)



E-commerce / Dropshipping | $500K–$1M Monthly Revenue



We are a fast-growing dropshipping company generating between $500K and $1M per month. We are looking for a highly structured, detail-obsessed and performance-driven A-player to fully own our Supply Chain Management and Parcel Panel control.



This role combines operational control, supplier management, refund processing, quality control, and fulfillment monitoring. You will be responsible for protecting our margins, delivery performance, and customer satisfaction.



This is not a beginner role. We need someone who thrives in accountability and precision.



Core Responsibilities

1. Refund & Cancellation Management



Process daily customer refunds.



Coordinate with suppliers for refunds and cancellations, especially for out-of-stock (OOS) items.



Ensure all refunds are logged and reconciled against supplier invoices.



Maintain 100% same-day supplier refund requests.



Zero missed OOS refund claims.



2. Order & Fulfillment Management



Monitor open Shopify orders daily.



Ensure no order remains open longer than 8 days.



Track fulfillment progress via Parcel Panel.



Investigate supplier delays and follow up immediately.



Escalate orders with delays over 48 hours, return-to-sender cases, pick-up issues, or address problems.



3. Parcel Panel Control



Verify that every fulfilled order has valid tracking information.



Ensure tracking statuses progress correctly (in transit, delivered, etc.).



Monitor supplier shipping speed and fulfillment times.



Check 150–250 orders per hour minimum.



Flag missing tracking numbers or incomplete fulfillments.



Provide daily summary reports.



Share weekly supplier performance reports.



4. Quality Control & Risk Monitoring



Perform daily quality checks on supply chain operations.



Review “best” and “risky” products weekly.



Enforce supplier quality standards.



Identify recurring fulfillment or product quality issues.



Support weekly supplier performance reviews.



5. Inventory & Pricing Oversight



Conduct weekly stock inventory checks (every Monday without exception).



Flag risky or unstable products.



Monitor product stability and supplier reliability.



Support margin protection by identifying issues early.



6. SOP Compliance & Communication



Ensure all SOPs are followed and up to date.



Monitor
 follow-up timelines to guarantee customers receive timely updates.



Maintain structured reporting and clean documentation.



Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)



Refund Accuracy



100% same-day logging and supplier requests.



Zero missed OOS refund claims.



Order Management



0 orders open longer than 8 days.



Fulfillment Monitoring



All 48h+ delays escalated immediately.



No missing tracking numbers.



Minimum 150–250 orders checked per hour.



Inventory Control



100% weekly stock check every Monday.



Reporting & Compliance



Daily summary reports submitted without delay.



Weekly supplier performance review delivered consistently.



All SOP timelines enforced and up to date.



Who You Are



Extremely detail-oriented.



Structured and disciplined.



Strong in Shopify, spreadsheets, and fulfillment systems.



Experienced in dropshipping or high-volume e-commerce.



Comfortable managing large order volumes.



Proactive and solution-driven.



Able to work independently without constant supervision.



Mentally strong in fast-paced, high-revenue environments.



If you are applying, start your application with the word strawberry so we know you read everything carefully.



We operate at scale. Small mistakes create big problems. We expect ownership, precision, and initiative.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to grow with a serious e-commerce business.



Kind regards,

Joel Rondhuis

title: Full-Time Editorial / Business Report Designer (Adobe InDesign)
description:
I am running a European B2B consulting & report business.



We create high-quality printed Business / Strategy Reports

(whitepaper / annual report style).

This is NOT social media design, NOT Canva, NOT flyers.



I am looking for ONE full-time designer for long-term cooperation.



Your main task:

- Layout & premium editorial design of Business / Whitepaper-style reports

- 16–24 pages per report

- Turn my final copy/text into clean, premium layouts

- Focus on typography, hierarchy, diagrams and visual clarity



Important:

These are NOT image-driven magazines.



The reports are content-heavy and argument-driven,

with approximately 1,000–1,700 characters of copy per page on average.



At the same time, design quality is critical:

- strong typography and clear hierarchy

- balanced and intentional use of white space (comfortable to read, but not empty)

- diagrams, charts and visual elements that allow the reader

  to understand key messages even without reading every line

- a premium, serious B2B look suitable for decision-makers



Tools:

- Adobe InDesign (required)

- Adobe Illustrator (for diagrams & graphics)

- Adobe Photoshop (image improvements)



Deliverables:

- InDesign source file

- Print-ready PDF



VERY IMPORTANT – Licensing rules (non-negotiable):

- Use ONLY license-free or properly licensed assets

- NO copying or stealing designs, templates or images

- Always provide image sources and license proof

- Creating your own graphics and diagrams is preferred

If licensing rules are violated, cooperation ends immediately.



Workload:

- Full-time remote

- Target after onboarding: 5–7 high-quality report designs per month

  (depending on complexity and structure)

- Quality and consistency are more important than speed



Salary & growth:

- Starting salary: ~550 USD per month (test & onboarding phase)

- Salary increases quickly based on performance and quality

- Possible increase up to 1,000+ USD per month or more over time

- Bonuses possible if clients are very satisfied



English:

- Basic English is enough

- Perfect English is NOT required



How to apply:

Please send:

1) Short introduction

2) Portfolio (editorial / business / report design preferred)

3) Your monthly salary expectation

4) Confirmation that you understand and accept the licensing rules



Applications without portfolio will be ignored.

title: E-commerce Video Editor (with AI experience)
description:
We are looking for a skilled, performance-driven E-commerce (Hair & Beauty/Hairstyling Industry) Video Editor to join our team full-time. Here, you aren’t just an editor. You are a creative strategist who understands direct-response marketing. You know how to CREATE scroll-stopping creatives that drive measurable results across Meta, TikTok, and YouTube. This role is not just about editing, t’s about understanding conversion psychology, hooks, pacing, and creative strategy.



In this role, you will blend traditional high-end editing with cutting-edge AI tools to produce winning ads at scale. If you are obsessed with conversion psychology, pacing, hooks, and staying ahead of the curve with new tech, we want to meet you.



Responsibilities:



1. Edit high-converting short-form video ads (UGC, product demos, testimonials, comparison ads)

2. Develop strong hooks within the first 3 seconds to maximize retention

3. Add captions, motion graphics, sound design, and platform-native elements

4. Collaborate with our media buyer and creative strategists to iterate based on performance data

5. Organize and manage project files efficiently

6. Generate AI-assisted creatives using image and video generation tools





AI & Creative Technology Requirements:



1. Experience writing effective AI prompts for video and image generation

2. Hands-on experience with tools such as Nanobanana, Arcads, and similar AI creative platforms

3. Ability to generate AI UGC-style videos and product B-roll

4. Experience refining outputs through prompt iteration

5. Understanding of how to integrate AI-generated assets into high-converting ad creatives



Requirements:



1. Proven experience editing e-commerce or direct-response ads

2. Strong understanding of retention, pacing, and conversion-focused storytelling

3. Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, CapCut, or similar tools

4. Deep understanding of TikTok-style and native-looking ad formats

5. Ability to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines

6. Strong attention to detail and creative problem-solving

7. To ensure you have read this entire job post, you MUST include the phrase "DR DOOM" in your cover letter title or
 subject line.

8. Willingness to learn new tools, trends, and evolving AI technologies



Character & Mindset:



1. Performance-oriented and results-driven

2. Proactive and self-motivated

3. Open to feedback and fast iteration

4. Strong communicator and team player

5. Adaptable in a fast-paced environment

6. Hungry to grow and continuously improve skills



How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and portfolio/reels specifically highlighting your short-form direct response ads, along with a brief video introduction of yourself and an explanation of your experience with AI video tools.

title: YouTube Video Editor Needed – Documentary Style
description:

I am now launching a new English YouTube channel, targeting a wider international audience, and I am looking for the right editor to help build this channel from the ground up.

Facecam recordings



Voice-over storytelling



Documentary-style editing



B-roll integration, music, pacing, and storytelling-driven edits



The goal is to reproduce the style and quality of established documentary-style YouTube channels (references will be provided privately).



We are aiming for:



1 to 2 long-form videos per week



Potential additional Shorts content later on



This means there will be consistent and ongoing work for the right person.



? Who I’m Looking For



Someone experienced with YouTube documentary-style editing



Strong storytelling and pacing skills



Ability to keep viewer retention high



Someone who understands YouTube standards and audience expectations



Reliable and interested in a long-term collaboration



This is not a beginner position — I’m specifically looking for someone who already has experience working with YouTube creators or documentary content.



Here exemple of the channel we need to copy: 
 



? Application Process



If you are interested:



Please apply to this job with examples of similar work you’ve done.

Looking forward to working together.



Thank you.

title: Google Ads & Landing Page Support Virtual Assistant
description:
We are a digital marketing agency looking for a detail-oriented Google Ads & Landing Page Support Assistant to help our Google Ads Manager with day-to-day tasks. This is an administrative/implementation role, not a senior strategist position.



Key Responsibilities

Google Ads administrative support



Assist with basic campaign setup (creating campaigns, ad groups, ads, adding keywords, extensions from provided structures or templates).



Make minor budget and bid changes as directed by the Google Ads Manager.



Perform daily/weekly account checks (disapproved ads, limited by budget, tracking issues, sudden drops in impressions or conversions).



Reporting and monitoring



Pull performance reports from Google Ads and Analytics (CTR, CPC, CPA, conversions, etc.).



Update report templates and dashboards with fresh data.



Flag notable changes or anomalies to the Google Ads Manager (e.g., big jumps in cost, conversions going down, new disapprovals).



Google support, policy, and verification



Open and manage support tickets with Google for disapprovals, policy questions, and technical issues.



Handle verification processes (business, advertiser, identity) following internal SOPs.



Keep organized records of all support interactions and outcomes.



Landing page and tracking support



Make minor edits to existing landing pages in Instapage, Unbounce, Webflow, and WordPress (text changes, image swaps, simple layout tweaks).



Add or update tracking scripts, pixels, and tags as instructed (e.g., Google tags, conversion tracking).



Nice-to-have: Help build new landing pages using templates or builders under guidance from the team.



Requirements

5+ years of full-time experience in a digital marketing, advertising, or virtual assistant role with regular exposure to Google Ads.



Comfortable working inside Google Ads: navigating the interface, updating campaigns, pulling data, and following clear instructions.



Basic understanding of performance metrics (impressions, clicks, CTR, CPC, conversions, CPA).



Experience with at least one of the following: Instapage, Unbounce, Webflow, or WordPress; able to make minor content and layout edits.



Basic HTML/CSS knowledge sufficient for small changes and troubleshooting simple layout issues.



Strong English communication skills (written and spoken).



Reliable internet connection and ability to work with some overlap in US business hours.



Nice-to-Have

Experience assisting with Google Ads account issues, policy disapprovals, or verification processes.



Prior work in an agency or in a support/assistant role for media buyers or marketing managers.



Experience building landing pages from templates and following simple CRO best practices.



Personal Attributes

Very detail-oriented and organized; comfortable working with numbers and checklists.



Follows instructions and SOPs accurately, but asks questions when something is unclear.



Responsive, reliable, and able to meet deadlines.



Comfortable working in tools like Slack,
, and a project management system (e.g., Asana/ClickUp/Trello).



How to Apply

Please apply through OnlineJobs.ph and include:



Your CV/resume.



A short note about your Google Ads experience (what you actually do day-to-day).



A brief description of which landing page tools you’ve used (Instapage, Unbounce, Webflow, WordPress) and what kind of edits you can do.



Answer this question in your message:



“What is one common Google Ads issue you’ve handled before (e.g., disapproval, tracking, verification), and how did you fix it?”



We will only review applications that follow all instructions above.

title: Bookkeeper – Irish Construction Clients (Remote, Philippines)
description:
About Us

We are a growing tax compliance practice based in Ireland, specialising in serving the construction industry.

 We're looking for a reliable, detail-oriented bookkeeper to join our team remotely.

The Role

You will handle monthly bookkeeping for Irish limited companies and sole traders in the construction sector. Your main responsibilities include:



Bank reconciliation in QuickBooks Online (weekly/monthly)

Categorising transactions accurately

Creating invoices based on RCT (Relevant Contracts Tax) payment notifications – we'll train you on this

Managing Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable

Preparing monthly financial reports

Communicating with clients to request missing documents



This is ongoing, steady work – not a one-time project.

Requirements

Must Have:



QuickBooks Online experience (minimum 2 years) – ProAdvisor certification is a plus

Bank reconciliation experience (minimum 2 years)

AP/AR experience (minimum 2 years)

Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Fluent English (written and spoken)

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

Reliable internet connection

Available for at least 4-6 hours/day (flexible schedule)



Nice to Have:



Experience with construction industry clients

Experience with Irish or UK accounting



What We Offer



Long-term, stable work with room to grow

Flexible hours – no fixed schedule, we care about results

Training on Irish RCT system and our processes

Payment via EasyPay (weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly – your choice)

Direct communication via WhatsApp/email (open to Slack/Teams)



Compensation

Hourly rate, negotiable based on experience. We may start with a small paid test task to assess fit.

How to Apply

Please reply with:



Your CV highlighting QuickBooks and bookkeeping experience

Your hourly rate expectation

Your availability (hours per day/week)

One sentence: Why are you a good fit for this role?



We usually respond within 1-2 working days.

title: Editorial Illustrator — Business Book Chapter Visuals
description:
I am the author of a business leadership book ("Dialogue of Work") 

currently in production. I need a creative illustrator to produce 

15 original editorial illustrations that bring key storytelling 


nts to life.



IMPORTANT: Unlike our infographic work, these visuals are created 

from scratch based on scene descriptions. They require creative 

interpretation, warmth, and human storytelling — not just technical 

execution.



THE WORK:

- 15 editorial illustrations for narrative 
nts in the book

- Examples of scenes: a leader and worker walking through a park 

  in Berlin, a circle of 15 people in a garden in Malaga, Spain, 

  a nursing home resident caring for a small potted plant, a 

  young professional in a Korean restaurant, an analytics expert 

  in deep concentration

- Each illustration comes with a written scene description and 

  the relevant book excerpt for context



STYLE REQUIREMENTS:

- Warm, professional, human — think editorial illustration for 

  Harvard Business Review or a Malcolm Gladwell book

- Abstract or semi-abstract figures (no hyper-realistic portraits)

- Color palette: 6 specific colors provided in style guide

- Must feel cohesive — all 15 illustrations from the same visual world

- Must work in grayscale for print fallback

- Book format: 6"×9", visuals up to 4.5" wide



DELIVERABLES:

- High-resolution PNG or SVG files (300 DPI minimum)

- Each illustration sized for print

- Consistent style across all 15 pieces



PROCESS:

- Week 1: Paid test task — one illustration from a provided 

  scene description

- If test passes: proceed with full project in batches of 3-4

- Feedback given within 24 hours per batch

- Maximum 2 revision rounds per illustration



SKILLS NEEDED:

- Strong editorial or conceptual illustration portfolio

- Experience illustrating human scenes and emotions

- Ability to work within a defined color palette and style guide

- Good English (for reading scene descriptions and book excerpts)

- Experience with print-ready file preparation preferred



TIMELINE: Approximately 8-10 weeks, flexible.



Please include 3-5 portfolio samples showing editorial or 

character-based illustration work when you apply. Applications 

without portfolio samples will not be considered.

title: WordPress Front-End Developer (Full-Time, Long-Term)
description:
Who We Are

We are a full-service interactive digital agency based in Southern California, working with clients all over the world. We are a passionate team of entrepreneurs in an established, growing agency focused on custom website development, design, SEO, mobile, and content marketing. You can learn more about us at: 



We’re looking for a reliable, detail-oriented WordPress Front-End Developer to join our remote team long-term.



Who You Are

You are an experienced front-end developer who enjoys building and maintaining modern, responsive WordPress websites. You are comfortable turning Figma/wireframes into clean, functional pages, and you care about code quality, layout accuracy, and user experience.



You will work closely with our design and development teams to create and maintain high-quality websites for our clients.



What You’ll Do

Build and maintain WordPress websites



Convert designs (Figma/wireframes/mockups) into responsive WordPress pages.



Implement themes and child themes, customize layouts, and configure plugins.



Make front-end updates: content changes, layout tweaks, styling adjustments.



Front-end development



Write clean, efficient HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for landing pages and site components.



Ensure cross-browser and cross-device compatibility.



Implement responsive design best practices for mobile, tablet, and desktop.



Quality & collaboration



Debug and fix layout or front-end issues as they arise.



Collaborate with designers, project managers, and other developers.



Follow internal standards, naming conventions, and simple documentation.



Must-Have Skills & Experience

5+ years of professional full-time experience in front-end web development.



Strong skills in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.



Extensive hands-on experience developing and updating WordPress sites (themes, page builders, plugins).



Proven experience with responsive design and cross-browser compatibility.



Experience using version control (Git or similar).



Good written and spoken English; comfortable communicating in a remote team environment.



Bonus Points (Nice to Have)

Prior work experience with a digital agency.



Experience working in the medical/healthcare space, especially aesthetics, plastic surgery, or behavioral health.



Hands-on experience with Webflow as well as WordPress.



Figma experience (reading designs, exporting assets, understanding layout).



Experience with Wrike or other project management tools (Asana, ClickUp, Jira, etc.).



Code bootcamp or self-taught background is welcome; a college degree is not required.



Work Setup & Benefits

Full-time, long-term position (not a short-term freelance gig).



Stable workload with an established agency and ongoing client projects.



Opportunity to learn, grow, and take on more responsibility over time.



How to Apply (Read Carefully – Simple Test)

To help us find candidates who pay attention to detail and read the full job post, please follow all of these steps:



Apply through OnlineJobs.ph with your resume/CV.



In your subject line, include:



WordPress Dev – [Your Name] – IM2025

(Example: WordPress Dev – Juan Dela Cruz – IM2025)



In the first line of your message, answer this question:



“Which WordPress-related task do you feel strongest at, and why?”



Include links to 3–5 live WordPress sites you worked on and briefly describe your role in each (what you actually did).



Tell us which tools you’ve used: WordPress, Webflow, Figma, Git, and any page builders (e.g., Elementor, WPBakery, Gutenberg, etc.).

title: Acquisitions Associate (Property Management)
description:
Role Overview

The Acquisitions Associate is responsible for building and managing Parity’s property acquisition pipeline. This role owns the front end of the development funnel: identifying absentee owners of vacant and distressed properties, maintaining a clean and accurate owner database, conducting outbound outreach, and negotiating purchase terms that align with Parity’s mission and financial parameters. This is a hands-on role that blends data management, outbound communication, negotiation, and coordination with legal and development teams.



Key Responsibilities

1. Acquisition Pipeline & Database Management

• Build, maintain, and continuously clean a database of absentee owners of vacant and distressed properties.

• Aggregate and verify ownership data from public records, tax data, and third-party sources.

• Track owner status, outreach history, responsiveness, and deal stage in Parity’s CRM or database.

• Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency across systems.



2. Owner Outreach & Relationship Management

• Execute outbound outreach campaigns via phone,
, and direct mail.

• Respond to inbound inquiries from property owners.

• Build rapport with owners and clearly communicate Parity’s mission, process, and timelines.

• Maintain consistent follow-up to move owners through the decision-making process.

3. Deal Evaluation & Negotiation

• Conduct preliminary deal screening based on location, condition, and feasibility.

• Negotiate purchase price and basic terms within pre-approved parameters.

• Coordinate property walk-throughs and inspections with internal teams.

• Prepare internal deal summaries and recommendations.

4. Transaction Coordination

• Work closely with legal counsel, title companies, and internal staff through contract and closing.

• Track deal milestones and ensure timely progression to settlement.

• Maintain organized records of contracts, correspondence, and transaction documents.

5. Process Improvement & Reporting

• Help refine acquisition workflows, templates, and outreach scripts.

• Track and report on key metrics such as outreach volume, response rates, conversions, and acquisitions.

• Identify bottlenecks and propose improvements to increase acquisition velocity.



Required Qualifications

• 2–5 years of experience in real estate, acquisitions, development, sales, or a related field.

• Strong organizational skills and comfort managing large datasets.

• Experience with outbound outreach (calls,
s, mail campaigns).

• Demonstrated negotiation skills and comfort having direct financial conversations.

• Clear, professional written and verbal communication.

• High attention to detail and follow-through.

• Experience with property acquisition.

• CRM and database experience (Airtable, HubSpot, etc.).

• Comfort working in a mission-driven, fast-paced environment.



Compensation, Growth, and Benefits

• Competitive compensation commensurate with experience

• Opportunity for performance-based bonuses as the company grows

• Direct mentorship from the founder and CEO

• 21 days of paid time off

Familiarity with HubSpot, ClickUp, Google Workspace, or content management tools.

Experience with
 marketing, newsletters, or social media content planning.

title: Digital Illustrator & Graphic Designer  (Illustrator, Photoshop, and AI like Midjourney)
description:
Role Overview

We’re looking for a creative and tech-savvy AI Artist to join our fully remote team at Mutual Paper. In this role, you’ll leverage generative AI tools to bring bold ideas to life through visuals, illustrations, and digital assets. You’ll collaborate with the founder and team to craft engaging content that elevates our brand and client projects, blending artistry with cutting-edge AI technology.



Key Outcomes

Deliver high-quality AI-generated artwork weekly that reflects Moonlight’s brand voice and meets project briefs, including marketing assets, social media content, and client-facing visuals.

Build and maintain a visual library of AI-generated assets that can be reused and repurposed across different campaigns, ensuring consistency in brand style and saving design time for future projects.

Experiment with and document best practices for AI art tools (e.g., MidJourney, Stable Diffusion, DALL·E), creating a repeatable process for prompt engineering, editing, and final output.

Collaborate with the marketing and recruitment teams to produce visuals that enhance campaigns, storytelling, and candidate engagement, delivering at least 3–4 unique creative sets per month.

Continuously push creative boundaries by proposing and testing new applications of AI art for brand storytelling, such as animations, branded templates, or multimedia experiments, with a goal of presenting at least one innovative idea each month.

Ensure timely delivery and revisions of all creative assets, meeting deadlines for campaigns, launches, and external client projects without compromising quality.

Vector & Type Posters: Design clean, modular poster systems (Bauhaus, geometric, text-art) using grids, precise typography, and scalable vector workflows.

Multi-Ratio Masters: Build 3:4 masters and adapt to 2:3 and 1:1 (e.g., 24×32 ? 24×36 ? 24×24) while preserving composition and hierarchy.

Print Production: Deliver press-ready assets (PDF/X with bleed), manage CMYK/spot/ICC profiles, outline/safeguard fonts, and export SVGs for web.

Photoreal Mockups: Composite frames into interiors (living rooms, bedrooms, offices) with believable lighting, reflections, grain, shadows, and scale.

Brand & Systems: Extend color/typography systems into ads, landing sections, and
 assets; maintain reusable templates and naming hygiene.

QA & Delivery: Versioning across sizes/ratios, final checks on crops, margins, ink coverage, overprint preview, and export specs.



Qualifications

Proven experience in digital art, illustration, or design (portfolio required)

Hands-on experience with AI art platforms (e.g., MidJourney, Stable Diffusion, DALL·E, or similar tools)

Strong creative vision with the ability to translate abstract concepts into compelling visuals

Knowledge of graphic design principles and attention to detail

Self-motivated, adaptable, and comfortable working in a fast-paced, remote environment

Adobe Illustrator (expert): vector systems, type composition, grid construction, poster production.

Adobe Photoshop (expert): retouching, compositing, texture/grain, photoreal staging.

Typography fundamentals: kerning, tracking, leading, optical vs metrics, OpenType features, baseline grids.

Color management for print (CMYK/spot, ICC) and web (sRGB/WebP); confident with PDF/X standards and print bleeds.

File hygiene: structured layers, styles, components, and clear versioning



Bonus: Familiarity with print-on-demand (Printful/Printify/Gelato) and pre-press basics (ink limits, trapping).

, Instagram, and Linkedin.

HOW MUCH CAN YOU EARN:

title: Outreach Specialist - Influencer & Affiliate Recruitment (Full Time, Remote) - $250/month + Bonuses
description:
Outreach Specialist (Full-Time, Remote)



Early-Stage EdTech Startup | Grow With Us



About VocabCartoons



We are VocabCartoons — a newly launched EdTech startup (launched November) creating animated vocabulary stories, games, and fun missions to help children learn English in a visual, ADHD-friendly way.



Our ambition is big.

We are building towards the scale of companies like Duolingo, with the long-term vision of becoming the “Netflix of kids’ learning.”



To make this happen, we are growing an affiliate and influencer network at scale, and we are now hiring Junior Outreach Specialist from the Philippines to join us early and grow with the company. The primary focus of the outreach will be the Indian market, but it may also expand to other countries as needed.



****Role Overview****



Full-time (40 hours/week)



Remote



Long-term



Outreach-focused ONLY

* No design

*No video editing

*No content creation



If you enjoy messaging people, researching influencers, and working towards clear targets in a fast-growing startup, this role is a great fit.



****Salary, Growth & Incentives****



**Base Salary**:

*$250 USD per month



*Performance Bonus:

*$0.50 USD for every new affiliate or influencer who signs up



*** Startup Growth Incentive (Important)***:

As VocabCartoons grows, we reward the people helping to build it.



***For every 1,000 new paying members the company reaches, base salaries are reviewed and increased by at least $50 USD, based on performance and role.***







This role is ideal for people who want to:



Join early



Grow their skills



Be part of something ambitious





Benefit as the company scales



*Probation Period



1-month paid probation





During probation we review:



Reliability



Communication



Outreach quality



Ability to follow templates



Consistency and effort



Successful candidates continue full-time with bonuses.







** Your Daily Responsibilities**



You will work on two core tasks:



1 Influencer Outreach



-Research micro-influencers (parents, teachers, homeschool, ADHD/SEN, education)



-Send DM/email outreach using ready-made templates



-Follow up 2–3 times



-Track replies and conversations



-Organize influencer lists in Google Sheets



2 Affiliate Recruitment



-Find potential affiliate partners



-Message them using provided scripts



-Track sign-ups



-Help new affiliates get started



-Submit daily progress reports







Who We’re Looking For (Please read this carefully)



-Experienced Outreach Specialist / Outreach influencer for at least 6 months -to 1 year



-Good written English



-Fast learner



-Reliable and consistent



-Comfortable with repetitive daily outreach



-Able to follow templates and instructions



-Positive, growth-focused mindset



-Interested in startups and long-term growth









Work Schedule



40 hours per week



Flexible working hours



Ideally 3–4 hours overlap with UK time (not required)







Tools You’ll Use



Google Sheets



Gmail



Instagram / TikTok /
 



Our outreach templates and systems







How to Apply (Important)



Please include the following in your application message:



1. Your CV

2. Screenshot of your internet speed (speedtest.net)

3. A short paragraph:

Why does a startup environment appeal to you?

4. Tell us about your background in being an Outreach specialist / Outreach Influencer

5. Optional but strongly preferred:

A 1-minute Loom video introducing yourself





Test Task (10–15 minutes)





Please complete the following:



1.) Find 5 influencers in any of these niches:



Parents



Homeschool blogs



Teachers



Education content



ADHD / Autism / SEN support



2.) Write 2 outreach messages you would send

3.) Share the links + messages in your application







Applicants who complete the test task go to the TOP of our shortlist.





What Success Looks Like



20–40 influencer/affiliate sign-ups per week



Consistent daily outreach



Accurate tracking



Clear communication



Reliability during probation







This is a long-term role for people who want:



Stability



Growth



Remote work



Performance-based bonuses



A supportive team



The chance to grow with an ambitious startup



We’re excited to work with people who believe in what we’re building.

nts

Head of Retention — Build a $100M Ecommerce Machine

If you’re an elite

Who We Are

We’re scaling a high-performance men’s underwear brand doing $0–3M/month, and we’re looking for a CRO Manager who can build funnels that maximize acquisition, conversion, and lifetime value.

We’
 profitably spent millions on
, TikTok, and Applovin ads.

 marketing & upsells.

 channel

A Cutting-Edge Marketing Team

Real Economics. Real Scale.

 is leverage.

 to $250k+/month

What We Offer

title: Graphic Artist (Full-Time / Remote)
description:
1. Company Overview



Complete Local Marketing is a premier digital marketing agency based in Puerto Rico. We believe that small and medium-sized enterprises deserve the same high-level branding and creative strategy as global corporations. Our mission is to bridge that gap through world-class visual storytelling, data-driven content, and performance-focused marketing. With a growing portfolio of 10+ active clients across various sectors, we are looking for a creative powerhouse to help us define the visual future of local business.



2. Role Summary



We are looking for a Graphic Designer who lives at the intersection of static design and motion. This is a high-impact, full-time role responsible for the end-to-end creation of visual assets for our entire client roster. You will be the "visual voice" for our clients, translating marketing strategies into high-converting graphics, polished video content, and cohesive brand identities. You will work in lockstep with our marketing strategists, social media managers, and web teams to ensure every pixel serves a purpose.



3. Employment Type & Work Schedule



Role: Full-Time (40 hours per week).

Location: 100% Remote.

Time Zone: Must be available during AST (Atlantic Standard Time) or U.S. Business Hours (EST/PST).

Time Tracking: Mandatory use of a Time Tracker for all hours worked

Hours logged through the tracker are the official record for billing and payment purposes



4. Compensation



Hourly Rate: USD $4/hour (including fees of chosen payment platform)

Invoice: Contractors are mandated to submit invoices that include their preferred payment channel.

Payment schedule: Bi-weekly payment issued every two (2) weeks upon receipt and approval of an invoice for services rendered.

Contractor responsible for all applicable taxes and statutory obligations







5. Core Responsibilities



Omnichannel Design: Produce creative assets for social media, paid ads, websites, and traditional print (menus/flyers).

Brand Stewardship: Develop and maintain brand-aligned templates for multiple clients simultaneously to ensure consistency.

Multimedia Content: Edit engaging video content ranging from 15-second Reels to long-form promotional brand stories.

Conceptualization: Participate in creative brainstorming sessions to develop campaign concepts based on client goals.

Asset Management: Maintain a highly organized library of raw files and final exports.

Efficiency: Meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced agency environment without compromising quality.



6. Graphic Design Responsibilities



Social & Digital: High-engagement Instagram/Facebook posts, carousels, and stories.

Paid Media: Eye-catching ad creative for Meta, Google Display, and LinkedIn.

Web Visuals: Hero images, icons, and custom graphics for landing pages.

Print: Occasional design for physical collateral, including menus, business cards, and event flyers.



7. Video Editing Responsibilities



Social-First Video: Cutting and optimizing content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts.

Post-Production: Color grading, basic sound design, and audio leveling.

Graphic Integration: Adding dynamic captions, transitions, and overlays to increase viewer retention.

Format Optimization: Re-formatting a single video asset for multiple platforms (e.g., 9:16 vs. 4:5 vs. 16:9).



8. Required Skills & Qualifications



Experience: 2+ years in a professional design/video role (Agency experience is a significant plus).

Technical Mastery: Advanced proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects, Canva, CapCut).

Platform Savvy: Understanding of what makes content go viral or convert on modern social platforms.

Branding Knowledge: Deep understanding of typography, color theory, and visual hierarchy.

Multitasking: Proven ability to manage creative deliverables for 10+ clients across different industries.



9. Preferred / Nice-to-Have Qualifications



Motion Graphics: Ability to create custom animations and dynamic logo reveals.

AI Integration: Experience using AI tools (Midjourney, Firefly, etc.) to speed up creative workflows.



10. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)



Content Performance: Engagement rates and ad conversion metrics of designed assets.

Turnaround Time: Adherence to internal production schedules and deadlines.

Brand Accuracy: Minimizing revision rounds through strict adherence to client brand guidelines.

Team Synergy: Success of collaborative projects with the marketing and web teams.



11. Tools & Platforms



Design: Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva (for client-facing templates).

Video: Premiere Pro, After Effects, CapCut (for quick social edits).

Management: ClickUp, WhatsApp, and Google Drive.



12. Technical Requirements (Mandatory)



To ensure a seamless remote workflow, the following hardware and connectivity standards are required:

PC / Laptop Requirements

Specs: High-performance machine capable of rendering 4K video and handling large PSD/AI files smoothly.

Operating System: Windows 10+ or MacOS 11+

RAM: 16-32 GB minimum

GPU: NVIDIA RTX 5080 (or higher)

Storage Space: At least 500GB or 1TB free for video files

Processor: i5 or equivalent (i7+ recommended)

PSU:
W

Audio: Built-in or USB microphone with clear sound

Verification: You must provide a screenshot of system specifications (CPU, RAM, GPU, OS).

Internet Requirements

Speed: Minimum 50 Mbps stable internet (Fiber preferred).

Verification: Must submit a recent speed test result screenshot.

Redundancy: Must have a reliable backup internet source (Secondary ISP or mobile hotspot).

Backup & Power Requirements

Hardware: Access to a backup laptop or secondary workstation.

Power Redundancy: UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply), generator, or power station to ensure uptime during local power interruptions.



13. Work Environment Expectations



A professional, quiet remote workspace suitable for video calls.

High level of accountability; you are expected to be reachable and active during working hours.

Proactive communication regarding project status and potential bottlenecks.



14. We want to know more about you



These questions are designed to assess the candidate’s creative process, technical skills, and ability to deliver cohesive visual and video content while maintaining brand consistency.



1. Tell us your step-by-step process on creating a design or layout, from receiving the brief to final delivery.

2. What design and video editing tools do you use most often (e.g., Canva, CapCut, Adobe Photoshop, Davinci Resolve, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects), and which are you strongest in?

3. Can you share examples of projects where you handled both graphic design and video editing, and explain your role in each?

4. How do you manage feedback and revisions, especially when working with tight deadlines or multiple stakeholders?

5. How do you ensure brand consistency (colors, fonts, tone, motion style) across both static designs and video content?



15. How to apply



To be considered for this role, please submit the following requirements in full:



- Answer the five (5) screening questions listed in the “We Want to Know More About You” section.

- Confirmation of your ability to work 40 hours/week during AST/EST business hours.

- Complete an internet speed test and provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your results that can be viewed by anyone with the link.

- Provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your PC or laptop specifications with viewers’ access enabled.

- Submit a portfolio via a shareable link (including graphic designs, videos, reels, or motion projects) that can be accessed by anyone with the link.

- Include your CV/resume (PDF format) through a shareable link with viewers’ access enabled.

- Record a 2–3 minute self-introduction video via Loom discussing your previous job roles, industries you’ve worked in, key career highlights, why you are the best candidate for this role, and whether you consider yourself more of an artist or a visionary—and why. Provide a shareable Loom link that can be viewed by anyone.



Incomplete applications or submissions without proper shareable links will not be reviewed.

title: Web and Marketing Designer (Wix, Figma)
description:
Job Description: Web + Marketing Designer (Wix Studio, Canva, Figma)



If you love turning messy notes into clean, on-brand pages… and you get weirdly excited about a well-structured resource hub (like “ah yes, hierarchy ????”), this might be your lane.



We’re looking for a Web + Marketing Designer who can help us ship a backlog of website pages and marketing assets fast—without needing constant approvals. This isn’t a “just make pretty things” role. It’s a take-ownership, ship consistently, and make the brand feel instantly more professional kind of role.



?



Your impact



Within 90 days, you’ll own a steady pipeline of polished web and marketing assets. You’ll help us:

• launch a content/resource hub with 20–25 high-quality pages

• create clean, consistent marketing + client education materials

• speed up how we communicate with clients (clearer visuals, better pages, smoother onboarding)



?



What you’ll do



Website build-outs (core focus)

• Build and refresh 20–25 website pages to kickstart a content/resource hub (feature launches, SOP-style guides, education pages)

• Work mainly in Wix Studio (if you’re strong in WordPress/CMS and can ramp fast, that’s totally acceptable)

• Turn rough wireframes/notes into polished pages with strong layout, hierarchy, and readability

• Make smart design decisions independently (no “waiting for the founder to approve every pixel” energy)



Marketing + client-education assets

• Create branded assets in Canva (LinkedIn carousel/swipe posts, onboarding visuals, lightweight collateral)

• Maintain brand consistency using our brand kit (fonts, colours, spacing, tone)

• Produce Figma mockups when needed (page concepts, component ideas, layout explorations) and translate them into live pages



Light ops + communication support (small but helpful)

• Support basic operations:
 triage, draft/reply to simple messages, flag priority items

• Gradually step into client onboarding/follow-ups once you understand the business (you may be looped into onboarding comms or occasional calls)



How we collaborate

• Daily comms:

• Files/docs: Google Workspace

• Documentation: Confluence (easy to learn)



?



Must-have qualifications (self-check)

• Formal design education (degree, diploma, or recognised certification) — not purely self-taught

• Strong portfolio showing web + marketing design (live links and/or case studies)

• Confident in Canva (independent creation of marketing assets)

• Confident in Figma (UI/UX mockups, layouts, components)

• Web platform capability: Wix Studio preferred, or strong WordPress/CMS experience and can ramp quickly

• Professional, client-ready English (written + spoken)

• Comfortable working with autonomy and initiative (minimal hand-holding)

• Secure home office + reliable internet



?



Nice to have (but not required)

• Wix Studio experience specifically (responsive rules, components, Studio builder)

• Experience designing education/resource hubs, knowledge bases, or feature launch pages

• Basic copywriting / UX writing instincts

• Confluence familiarity or experience documenting workflows

• Comfortable using AI tools to speed up drafts (with good judgment)



?



Success outcomes (30 / 60 / 90 days)



30 days — settled in + shipping

• Learn the brand + cadence

• Ship your first pages/assets with minimal revisions

• Establish a weekly rhythm (plan early-week, deliver end-week)



60 days — consistent output

• Reliably produce high-quality pages and Canva assets end-to-end

• Confidently handle simple client follow-ups/onboarding comms



90 days — pipeline owner

• Own the web + marketing design pipeline

• Clear the initial backlog of pages

• Reduce founder involvement to quick reviews vs constant direction



?



Why this role matters



The business is growing and shipping features, but design + content updates are bottlenecked by founder capacity. Your work directly improves:

• how customers understand the product

• how polished the brand looks

• how smooth onboarding feels



If you want a role that starts design-heavy and can grow into broader ops/client support, you’ll fit here.

title: Full-Time Social Media Manager (Organic Growth Focus) – Remote
description:
We are a growing marketing agency working with businesses worldwide, and we are looking for a full-time Social Media Manager to join our remote team.



This role is for someone who understands how to grow brands organically through strategic content, community building, and influencer collaborations. This is not a basic scheduling or posting role. We are looking for someone who can manage social media end-to-end and drive measurable growth.



ROLE OVERVIEW



You will be responsible for managing and growing our presence across:



1.
 (X)

2.

3. Instagram

4. TikTok

5. LinkedIn

6. Any additional platforms we expand into



Your focus will be on organic reach, engagement, brand authority, and strategic influencer partnerships.



RESPONSIBILITIES



You will:



1. Research trends, audience behavior, and content opportunities within marketing and local business niches

2. Develop strategic content ideas designed to drive organic growth

3. Write compelling copy for posts, captions, hooks, threads, carousels, and calls to action

4. Design posts, carousels, stories, and short-form videos using Canva

5. Create reels and short-form videos using Canva templates

6. Plan and manage a structured content calendar

7. Optimize content per platform including format, tone, timing, and algorithm behavior

8. Monitor engagement and actively build community through comments, DMs, and conversations

9. Track performance metrics and refine strategy based on data insights

10. Identify and research relevant influencers within our niche

11. Conduct influencer outreach via DM or
, build partnerships, and coordinate collaborations

12. Track influencer campaign performance and ensure alignment with brand goals

13. Collaborate with our internal team to align content and partnerships with overall marketing strategy



REQUIREMENTS



To be considered, you must:

1. Have proven experience managing social media accounts for brands or agencies

2. Demonstrate strong content writing and copywriting skills

3. Have experience with influencer outreach or partnership coordination

4. Be capable of independent research on trends, competitors, and niche influencers

5. Have solid working knowledge of Canva for posts, carousels, reels, and short videos

6. Understand how organic growth works on TikTok, Instagram, LinkedIn,
 (X), and

7. Be comfortable initiating conversations and building relationships with influencers

8. Be available for a full-time remote position

9. Be organized, reliable, and deadline-driven

10. Think strategically, not just creatively



PORTFOLIO REQUIREMENT (IMPORTANT)



Your application must include:

HOW TO APPLY



Start your application with the phrase:



SOCIAL MEDIA BUILDER

2. Links to your portfolio and previous social media work

4. Your expected monthly salary

We are looking for someone who takes ownership, understands organic growth deeply, can build strategic influencer relationships, and wants to grow long-term with a marketing agency.

title: Ad Creative  Editor | Full Time
description:
At Sole Assistant, we place VAs into stable, long-term roles with US-based ecommerce businesses. We have hired and placed more than 300 VAs in the last 3 years and currently support over 75 active roles. Our mission is to give talented Filipino VAs a real career pathway, not a short-term gig.

If you are coachable, fast, and eager to grow, this is the right opportunity for you.



Why Work With Sole Assistant:



• Stable full-time work with long-term clients

• Clear SOPs so you always know what to do

• Growth opportunities as you improve your skills

• 3-month employment guarantee (Average employment is 12+ months)

• We will replace you with another company if let go



We have a large network of businesses actively hiring, which allows us to place strong candidates quickly.



Role: Ad Creative Editor

Rate: $5/hour | Around PHP46,000+ per month



About the Role:

The purpose of the Editor Role at our brand is to process ad briefs from our creative team and bring them to life through the power of editing.



As an Editor, you are responsible for the actual execution & applying the finishing touches on all the ads we create. Our success as a marketing team will rely on your ability to comprehend each ad concept, strategically put the pieces together, and enhance the overall marketing message with your edits.



You understand that the smallest details can make the biggest differences. So, you take pride in paying immense attention to detail in everything you do as those details can be the difference between an ad that is shown to millions & an ad that is shown to very few.



Your active purpose at our brand is to work alongside our Creative Directors and Copywriters to edit & bring to life ad briefs, utilize our creative resources, and help produce winning ads month over month for our clients.



If you are a perfect fit, you will be given documents as well as reference winning ads and what makes those ads a winner and those must be studied for not only our business success but yours as well at our company. Must be ready to create 6-7 batches a week, as well as an onboarding quiz on what makes a winning ad and our target customer.



Direct Experience Qualifications:

- 1 Year of experience in video editing or designing ads

- 1 Year of experience in CapCut, Photoshop

- 1 Year of experience editing eCommerce ads

- Experience with HeyGen

- Experience with Higgsfield

- Experience with eleven labs

- Nano bannana

- Sora 2

- Working in a team environment & understanding individual roles



Character Traits:

- Excruciatingly high level of attention to detail with all designs & edits

- Artistic & creative oriented mindset

- Visual communicator & storyteller

- High curiosity & an active imagination

- Strong willingness to do the ‘boring’ work required

- Great communicator with the team

- Time-efficient, but willing to spend extra time to do things right

- Coachable & desire to grow skill set & personal traits



Message from the founder: The main goal of this role is to take you in house on our team and carry you up to the top as we grow. If you put the hours into the work even over time when you want to we offer compensation on winning creatives. Basically if you’re a beast and the edit gets a ton of sales we’ll give you a percentage of the sales generated, lots of money to be made on this, but you have to be a super hard worker. We are working hard for the multi-7 figure mark next year. We take care of our team to the fullest extent if you give that same compassion back into the role. We want someone as hungry as we are to grow and scale far.



How to Apply:

1. Fill out this Screening form:

2. Message us on OnlineJobs with this exact subject line: [Your Full Name] – [Your Favorite Shoe Brand]

3. At the end of your OnlineJobs message, answer this question in 3 to 5 sentences

title: Short-Form Video Editor
description:
Responsibilities:

* Edit short-form video content (Reels, Shorts) using brand guidelines and trending formats

* Craft engaging edits that emphasize storytelling, mood elevation, and product benefits

* Trim, sequence, and time clips for maximum viewer retention and impact

* Incorporate music, captions, text overlays, transitions, and visual effects

* Work with the team to iterate on creative feedback and revisions quickly

* Maintain an organized content library of raw footage, project files, and exports

* Suggest content angles, hooks, and edit styles based on platform trends and insights

* Ensure consistency in video style, pacing, and messaging across different content series

* Assist with repurposing content for paid ads, whitelisting, and promotional campaigns

* Full vlog edits: cutting out unnecessary parts, adding transitions, and ensuring a cohesive flow

* Final cuts on music & performance videos: syncing audio, color grading, subtitling, and adding effect



Requirements:

* 3+ years of experience in short-form video editing, ideally within CPG or eCommerce

* Proficient in editing tools like Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, CapCut, or DaVinci Resolve

* Strong understanding of social media content formats, platform trends, and viral hooks

* Excellent attention to detail with a creative, problem-solving mindset

* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects with tight deadlines

* Fluent in English with strong written and verbal communication skills

* Experience collaborating with content creators, marketing teams, and paid media teams

- Identify system sizes (e.g., 2kW–13.3kW systems)

- Assist with field service scheduling within CRM

- Work across integrated platforms including:

---Solar Plus

---Bridge Select

---My Up

---Solar Us

- Ensure clean, consistent, accurate data across systems



3. Pre-Alert & Post-Install Coordination

- Support post-install connection admin

- Assist with compliance documentation and system updates

- Follow up persistently where required



4. Scheduling & Communication Support

- Assist with installation scheduling

- Update and manage Google Calendar bookings

- Communicate with internal team via
 and phone

- Potentially support outbound follow-up calls if required



Required Skills & Experience

Essential:

- Previous experience in solar PV

Strong understanding of:

--- Solar system sizes (kW capacity)

--- Inverters and their role

--- Solar panels and configurations

--- Single-phase vs three-phase systems

--- Reading and interpreting purchase orders

- High accuracy in data entry

- Experience using CRMs (Salesforce preferred)

- Strong written and verbal English communication



Highly Desirable:

- Experience with Salesforce

- Experience with solar compliance/admin processes

- Experience supporting builder or construction projects

- Experience with grid connections or post-install paperwork



Why You’ll Love Working With Us

- AU time zone working hours (no graveyard shifts)

- We’re a passionate, forward-thinking team (and genuinely good humans)

- Growth opportunities as we expand

- Supportive culture where initiatives and ideas are celebrated
