title: thesis writer
description:
Thesis writing:



Assignment overview: Project proposal (4000 words)



In this assignment, you will have the opportunity to showcase your intellectual depth, problem-solving skills, and dedication to data-driven solutions. The goal is to demonstrate your competence in executing the Problem Definition and Analysis and Diagnosis steps for the LYCar project. Your proposal should be comprehensive, well-structured, and convincing, highlighting your preparedness for the Execution phase.



**Document content**



**Chapter 1: Problem Definition**

In the first chapter, you will set the stage by providing necessary background information and identifying key stakeholders related to the case situation. Your task is to clearly define the problem your project aims to address. You should analyze the problem and utilize various sources of evidence to showcase your broad knowledge base on the subject matter, supporting your problem statement effectively.



**Chapter 2: Literature Review**

The second chapter involves an exploration of relevant literature, where you will analyze different scenarios, factors, and potential solutions relevant to the research problem. Your analysis should be well-rounded, considering multiple perspectives and demonstrating intellectual depth. Present well-reasoned arguments and propose potential courses of action to tackle the identified problem. Develop a conceptual framework and formulate research questions that will guide your study.



**Chapter 3: Methodology (Plan)**

This chapter is of utmost importance as it demonstrates your expertise in applying the acquired knowledge and theory into your research strategy. You will outline your research design and methodology, describing the structured and systematic approach you will use to investigate the problem identified in Chapters 1 and 2. Justify the selected research methods, ensuring the reliability and validity of data collection. Additionally, competently address any ethical and data management issues related to your research.



**Chapter 4: Dissemination (Plan)**

Explain how your project will have meaningful impact on the company. Develop a clear and actionable plan for disseminating the knowledge and insights derived from your study and highlight various valuable channels through which you will share your findings with key stakeholders. Discuss how you will provide proof of sufficient interaction with these stakeholders.

title: Infographic Designer — Business Book Visual Finisher
description:
I am the author of a business leadership book ("Dialogue of Work") 

currently in production. I need an experienced infographic designer 

to take AI-generated draft visuals and finish them to professional 

print quality.



IMPORTANT: You are NOT designing from scratch. AI tools have 

already generated rough drafts with the correct content, layout, 

and logic. Your job is to refine, correct, and polish them to 

match our exact visual style guide.



THE WORK:

- 35 infographic visuals total (framework diagrams, comparison 

  charts, process flows, data visualizations)

- Each visual comes with: an AI draft + a detailed prompt 

  describing exactly what it should contain

- You match colors, typography, spacing, and layout to our 

  style guide (provided on day one)



STYLE REQUIREMENTS:

- Color palette: 6 specific colors with exact hex codes (provided)

- Typography: Helvetica Neue / Arial, clean sans-serif

- Containers: 8px rounded corners, subtle drop shadows

- Abstract geometric human figures only (no detailed faces)

- Must be print-ready for 6"×9" business book format

- Must work in grayscale



DELIVERABLES:

- SVG or high-resolution PNG files (300 DPI minimum)

- Each visual sized for 4.5" print width

- Consistent visual language across all 35 pieces

- Final files organized and labeled by chapter and figure number



PROCESS:

- Week 1: Paid test task — finish 1 visual to confirm style match

- If test passes: proceed with full project in batches of 5-7 visuals

- Feedback given within 24 hours of each batch submission

- Maximum 2 revision rounds per visual



SKILLS NEEDED:

- Adobe Illustrator, Figma, or equivalent vector design tool

- Experience with infographics or business publication design

- Attention to exact color matching and typography precision

- Able to follow a strict style guide without creative deviation

- Good English (for reading content descriptions)



TIMELINE: Approximately 6-8 weeks, flexible.



Please include 2-3 portfolio samples of infographic or diagram work 

when you apply.

5. Key Responsibilities



Local SEO Strategy: Develop and execute end-to-end local SEO roadmaps tailored to specific industry needs.

On-Page Optimization: Execute comprehensive audits and updates to metadata, headers, internal linking, and localized content.

GBP Management: Daily optimization and management of Google Business Profiles to dominate the "Local Map Pack."

Keyword Intelligence: Perform deep-dive research into local intent keywords to capture high-converting traffic.

Technical SEO: Conduct audits focusing on site speed, mobile-friendliness, crawlability, indexing, and basic Schema/Structured Data implementation.

Reporting: Create and present monthly performance reports that translate data into actionable insights for clients.

Competitor Analysis: Monitor local competitors to identify gaps and opportunities for our clients.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with the web and content teams to ensure all site updates are SEO-friendly.



6. Required Skills & Qualifications



Proven Experience: 2+ years of experience as an SEO Specialist (Agency experience preferred).

Local SEO Mastery: Deep understanding of local citations, proximity factors, and regional search trends.

Tool Proficiency: Expert-level use of Google Search Console, Google Analytics (GA4), and industry tools (Ahrefs, SEMrush, or BrightLocal).

CMS Familiarity: Proficiency in WordPress (experience with builders like Elementor or Divi is a plus).

Analytical Prowess: Ability to synthesize data from various sources to provide a clear picture of ROI.

Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English.



7. Preferred / Nice-to-Have Qualifications



Direct experience handling SEO for multiple businesses 

Knowledge of Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) principles.



8. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)



Significant month-over-month organic traffic growth.

Improvement in rankings for targeted local search terms.

Growth in Google Business Profile interactions (calls, directions, website visits).

Timely completion of all client deliverables and monthly reports.



9. Tools & Platforms Used



SEO/Analytics: Google Search Console, GA4, Ahrefs/SEMrush.

Local SEO: BrightLocal, Whitespark, or similar.

Project Management: ClickUp, Asana, or 
.

Communication: Slack and Zoom/Google Meet.



10. Technical Requirements (Mandatory)



To ensure seamless collaboration and high-quality output, candidates must meet the following technical standards:



PC / Laptop Requirements

Operating System: Windows 10+ or MacOS 11+

RAM: 8 GB minimum

Storage Space: At least 250GB or 1TB 

Processor: i5 or equivalent (i7+ recommended)

Backup PC/Laptop in case of an issue

Verification: You must provide a screenshot of system specifications.



Internet Requirements

Speed: Minimum 50 Mbps stable internet (Fiber preferred).

Verification: Must submit a recent speed test result screenshot.

Redundancy: Must have a reliable backup internet source (Secondary ISP or mobile hotspot).



Backup & Power Requirements

Hardware: Access to a backup laptop or secondary workstation.

Power Redundancy: UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply), generator, or power station to ensure uptime during local power interruptions.



Backup & Power Requirements:

Hardware: Access to a backup laptop or secondary device.

Power: Must have an electricity backup solution (UPS, generator, or power station) to remain online during local power outages.



11. Work Environment Expectations



Professional Setup: A dedicated, quiet workspace free from distractions.

Communication: Proactive updates on task progress via Slack.

Engagement: Ability to attend and participate in virtual tea
etings with camera on.



12. We want to know more about you



These questions are designed to assess the candidate’s abilities, technical skills, and ability to deliver excellent results.

- Describe your step-by-step process for conducting an SEO audit on a website, including tools you use and metrics you analyze.

- Can you give an example of a project where your SEO strategy significantly improved organic traffic or rankings? What approach did you take?

- Which SEO tools and platforms are you most proficient in (e.g., Google Analytics, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog), and how do you use them in daily tasks?

- How do you approach on-page and off-page optimization, and what strategies do you use to stay compliant with search engine algorithm updates?

- Explain a situation where you had to solve a complex SEO problem, such as recovering from a traffic drop or resolving technical SEO issues. What was your process and outcome?



13. How to apply



To be considered for this role, please submit the following requirements in full:

- Answer the five (5) screening questions listed in the “We Want to Know More About You” section.

- Confirmation of your ability to work 20 hours/week during AST/EST business hours.

- Complete an internet speed test and provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your results that can be viewed by anyone with the link.

- Provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your PC or laptop specifications with viewers’ access enabled.

- Submit a Portfolio/Case Studies via a shareable link; these may include Links or documents showcasing previous SEO wins (specifically local rankings/growth) that can be accessed by anyone with the link.

- Include your CV/resume (PDF format) through a shareable link with viewers’ access enabled.

- Record a 2–3 minute self-introduction video via Loom discussing your previous job roles, industries you’ve worked in, key career highlights, SEO Innovations, why you are the best candidate for this role, and as an SEO Specialist, do you consider yourself more of a strategist (focusing on long-term SEO planning and overall strategy) or a tactician (executing specific SEO tasks and optimizations)?—and why. Provide a shareable Loom link that can be viewed by anyone.





Incomplete applications or submissions without proper shareable links will not be reviewed.

title: Content Manager/Content Curator – Video Podcast Remote
description:
Company Overview:

We are 37 Projects, a fast-growing YouTube Video Marketing Agency that helps health and wellness brands maximize their reach through high-quality video content, Shorts, and podcast marketing. We’re looking for a YouTube & Podcast Content Manager who can analyze long-form podcasts, craft compelling YouTube Shorts & Clips, and ensure all content aligns with the client’s brand voice and audience engagement strategies.



I. Content Manager Responsibilities



1. Content Consumption



- Watch 1–2 hour video podcasts on health, fitness, and nutrition topics.

- Develop a deep understanding of each podcast’s themes and key messages to inform content creation.



2. Clip & Short Identification (NOT Editing)



- Identify segments ideal for YouTube Clips and YouTube Shorts.

- Select the best 
nts for intros that build a compelling storytelling narrative.



3. Content Strategy & Quality Assurance



- Ensure all clips, shorts, and intros align with the client’s brand voice and content strategy.

- Perform content-only quality checks on first rough-cut videos (focus on flow, clarity, and messaging—not captions, graphics, or motion design).



4. Intros & Trailers



- Select punchy and engaging 
nts from the podcast to be used in the trailer (approx. 70–80 seconds).

- Provide editors with timestamps and key sentences to include, ensuring the trailer highlights the right topics or subtopics.

- Collaborate with the Project Manager and Video Editor to align on creative direction and client expectations.



Example: Similar to Steven Bartlett’s Diary of a CEO trailers, which combine intro narration with short, high-impact clips.



II. Scope of Work



- Manage content across five clients.

- Watch and process around 15–16 podcasts per month (on average, 3–4 per client).

- Produce selections for around 8 trailers per month (?2 per week, one per client).

- Deliverables include weekly clips, shorts, and trailers, ensuring consistency across all client channels.

- Collaborate closely with Project Managers and Video Editors to maintain smooth production flow and client satisfaction.



III Requirements:



1. Availability & Commitment:

- Full-time remote position - no other job commitments to ensure focus.

- Must have a high-performance laptop/computer and stable internet.



2. Experience & Education:

- Proven experience in video editing or podcast production (video/audio).

- Graduates in Communication, Multimedia, or Video Production are highly preferred.

- Experience in YouTube content creation (Shorts, Clips, long-form podcasts) - a bonus



3. Skills & Tools:

- SEO writing experience is a plus.

- Strong organizational and time management skills to handle multiple projects.

- Proficiency in:

   + Slack

   + Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive)

   + Notion

   + AI writing tools (ChatGPT, Claude)

   + YouTube SEO tools (VidIQ, SEMrush) – a bonus



4. Strong storytelling ability to identify and structure the most compelling 
nts in videos.



5. Preferred Bonus Skills:

- Knowledge of health, fitness, and nutrition topics (to select key 
nts effectively).

- Creative mindset with the ability to suggest innovative content formats & strategies.



???? How to Apply

???? Fill out this form to apply:

title: E - Commerce Video Editor
description:
Overview

We are seeking an exceptional, data-driven Video Editor obsessed with driving conversions for e-commerce/DTC brands. This is a fast-paced role requiring a marketer's mindset, platform expertise, and rapid iteration based on performance data.



Core Responsibilities (What You Will Do)

Conversion Focus: Edit raw footage (often UGC-style) into scroll-stopping, short-form ads (15-60 seconds) for Meta, TikTok, and YouTube, focused entirely on driving sales.



DR Implementation: Structure videos using Direct Response (DR) frameworks (e.g., Problem-Agitate-Solution), ensuring a powerful hook in the first 3 seconds, and seamless CTA integration.



Technical Execution: Apply advanced post-production techniques: color grading, audio mixing, speed ramping, dynamic transitions, and creating engaging typography/subtitles.



Rapid Iteration: Maintain fast turnaround (24 for first cuts) and produce multiple testing variations based on performance metrics (CTR, ROAS, Hook Rate).



Platform Mastery: Optimize content (9:16, 1:1, etc.) for native feel and best practices across TikTok, Reels, and YouTube Ads.



Pre-requisites (Must-Haves)

Experience: Proven portfolio of successful e-commerce/DTC ad editing (not just cinematic/corporate work).



Software Mastery: Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro or Final Cut Pro.



Mindset: Deep understanding of DR Marketing and key metrics (ROAS, CTR). Must be performance-driven, flexible, and willing to iterate based on data without ego.



Skills: Expertise in UGC-style editing, audio/sound design, and closed captioning/subtitles.



Bonus Skills

Proficiency in After Effects, CapCut, or DaVinci Resolve.



Familiarity with ad platforms and marketing metrics.



Workload: Initial paid trial project, then transitioning to 20 hours per week ongoing.



Shift: Flexible hours; work is output-based with strict deadlines.



To Apply:

If you are an exceptional designer with a portfolio that demonstrates world-class DTC brand quality, kindly fill out the application form:






Looking forward to receiving your application!

title: Creative Video Production Editor
description:
We are seeking a reliable and creative Video Production Editor to support our growing content studio on a casual, project based basis. This is a behind the scenes role suited to an overseas editor who can deliver high quality social first video content efficiently, while balancing creativity with structured systems.



You will be responsible for executing the post production process from raw footage to first draft delivery. This includes uploading and organizing content by camera, scene, and shoot date, maintaining clean folder structures, and ensuring every project is structured clearly for fast collaboration. Strong attention to detail and file management is essential.



Once footage is organized, you will assemble timelines based on provided scripts, briefs, or reference edits. You must be confident following direction and brand guidelines, while also contributing creative flair in pacing, transitions, visual rhythm, and storytelling. We want someone who can think creatively, not just mechanically cut clips together.



Music selection is part of your responsibility. You should be able to source appropriate tracks that align with brand tone and emotional intent. All edits must have clean audio balance, smooth cuts, and strong flow suitable for modern social media platforms.



We supply LUTs and brand guidelines. Your responsibility is to color correct footage to a high standard before applying our LUTs, adjusting exposure, white balance, skin tones, and contrast to ensure clean, consistent visuals. You do not need advanced cinematic grading skills, but you must understand how to make footage look polished and professional.



Completed drafts must be uploaded to Frame for client review. You will implement client feedback accurately and efficiently. Turnaround expectations are 24 to 72 hours for first draft delivery depending on project scope, and 24 hour turnaround for revisions once feedback is received.



This role is fully behind the scenes. You will not communicate directly with clients but must communicate clearly and proactively with our internal team regarding timelines, questions, and updates.



The ideal candidate is dependable, responsive, detail oriented, and committed to meeting deadlines. You must be proficient in CapCut and Adobe Premiere Pro. Experience editing short form, social first content such as Reels and vertical video is highly preferred.



This is a casual role with work assigned as projects come in, with the opportunity for increased responsibility and hours as the company scales.



Please check out the level of our work on our 
 to see if you think you can nail our style.

Or this link:

title: Senior Financial Controller / Accountant
description:
Senior Financial Controller / Senior Accountant (Part-Time, Remote – Philippines)



Company: European Specialty Coffee & Distribution Group

Structure: Czech Operating Company + US Holding Company

Location: Remote (Philippines – CET overlap required)

Employment Type: Part-Time (20–30 hours per week)

Reports To: Managing Director (Europe)

 

About Us



We are a growing European specialty coffee roasting, distribution, and service company headquartered in the Czech Republic, with a US holding company structure. Our group operates across multiple business lines including wholesale coffee, tea distribution, service operations, and retail cafés.



We are currently implementing Odoo ERP to streamline operations, financial reporting, and international consolidation.



We are seeking a highly capable Senior Financial Controller / Senior Accountant to support financial oversight, reporting, and consolidation while supervising our Philippines-based Back Office & Data Entry team.

 

Position Overview



This is a senior-level remote accounting and financial control role supporting a European company with US consolidation requirements.



You will:

• Oversee day-to-day accounting accuracy

• Supervise and manage a Philippines-based Back Office / Data Entry Specialist

• Ensure accurate data entry and transaction integrity within Odoo ERP

• Coordinate with our external Czech accounting firm (compliance-only)

• Support EU VAT, OSS, and Intrastat reporting oversight

• Assist with GAAP adjustments and consolidation for US holding company reporting

• Prepare documentation for statutory filings

• Support US year-end closing and, if qualified, assist with US filings



This is not a pure bookkeeping position. It requires ownership, financial analysis capability, and multi-entity experience.

 

Key Responsibilities



1. Financial Oversight & Reporting

• Oversee monthly closing process (target: within 10 business days)

• Review general ledger accuracy

• Perform monthly reconciliations (AR, AP, inventory, intercompany)

• Prepare consolidated financial statements (CZ + US structure)

• Deliver monthly management reporting:

o P&L by business line

o Gross margin analysis

o Cash flow forecast (13-week rolling)

o Budget vs actual

o Inventory valuation review

• Monitor financial KPIs

 

2. Supervision of PH Back Office Team

• Direct supervision of Back Office & Data Entry Specialist

• Review invoice processing accuracy

• Monitor payment matching and AR aging

• Ensure pricing and VAT codes are correctly applied in Odoo

• Create and maintain SOPs for transaction processing

• Implement internal controls within Odoo



You will be responsible for ensuring all operational accounting data is properly entered before submission to the Czech external accountant.

 

3. ERP Oversight (Odoo Preferred)

• Oversee accounting and finance configuration within Odoo

• Ensure proper chart of accounts structure

• Maintain VAT logic and tax mapping

• Coordinate ERP data exports for Czech accountant

• Improve financial workflows

• Support automation and efficiency improvements



Experience in Odoo or Zoho Books/Zoho ERP is strongly preferred.

 

4. European Compliance Coordination

• Prepare VAT documentation for Czech external accounting firm

• Assist with OSS reporting structure

• Oversee Intrastat documentation

• Review compliance documents prior to submission

• Maintain clean audit trail



External Czech firm will handle official filings — you ensure readiness and correctness.

 

5. US Holding Company Consolidation & GAAP

• Assist in consolidation of Czech accounts into US holding company

• Perform GAAP adjustments where required

• Prepare reporting for US entity

• If qualified, assist in US year-end closing and corporate filings

• Manage intercompany accounting and transfer documentation



Experience with US GAAP and multi-entity consolidation is highly valued.

 

Scope of Work

• Multi-entity structure (EU + US)

• Wholesale & distribution business

• Inventory-intensive operations

• VAT, OSS, and international transactions

• Intercompany accounting

• Multi-currency operations

 

Required Qualifications

• CPA or equivalent certification preferred

• 5+ years senior accounting experience

• Experience with EU VAT systems

• Experience with multi-entity accounting

• Experience with US GAAP or consolidation reporting

• Strong Excel proficiency

• Experience in Odoo or Zoho ERP preferred

• Experience supervising accounting staff

• Excellent written and verbal English

 

Ideal Candidate Profile

• Structured and process-driven

• Strong analytical mindset

• Comfortable working independently

• Experience in international SME environment

• Detail-oriented but able to see strategic picture

• Capable of building financial dashboards

• Proactive in identifying inefficiencies

 

KPIs

• Monthly close ? 10 days

• Inventory variance < 1%

• Clean reconciliation reports

• Accurate VAT mapping

• Timely consolidated reporting

• AR aging within target range

 

What We Offer

• Long-term strategic role

• Direct exposure to international business structure

• Opportunity to shape financial systems

• Flexible remote work

• Competitive compensation (based on experience)

• Potential growth into CFO-level role

 

Working Hours



Must overlap with Central European Time (CET) for at least 3–4 hours daily.

 

To Apply



Please submit:

• Updated CV to 

• Summary of relevant multi-entity experience

• ERP systems experience (Odoo/Zoho preferred)

• Confirmation of availability (hours per week)

• Expected monthly compensation

title: Paid Media Reporting & Analytics Specialist (Search & Social)
description:
Paid Media Reporting & Analytics Specialist (Search & Social)



Remote — Philippines | Full-Time



About SocialScience



SocialScience is a growth marketing agency that manages paid search and paid social campaigns for high-growth brands across B2B and DTC. We specialize in performance-driven creative testing and media strategy designed to reduce customer acquisition costs and scale revenue.

We are hiring a Paid Media Reporting & Analytics Specialist to become the central data engine behind all client performance reporting across platforms.

This is not a virtual assistant role. This is a performance marketing analytics role for someone who understands how ad platforms work and how to read, organize, and interpret paid media data.



Role Overview

You will be responsible for pulling, organizing, and analyzing performance data across multiple advertising platforms three times per week (Monday, Wednesday, Friday). You will maintain standardized reporting across clients, identify performance trends, and support our media buying team with clean, reliable data that helps drive decisions.

Over time, you will also help build cross-client insights, creative performance tracking, audit preparation, and budget pacing systems.

You will become the data nerve center for all SocialScience clients.



Key Responsibilities

Core Reporting (Primary Responsibility)

Pull performance reports from:

Google Ads

Meta Ads Manager

LinkedIn Campaign Manager

TikTok Ads Manager

Google Analytics (GA4)

Update master reporting sheets for all clients (3x per week)

Maintain consistent, accurate data across all client reporting templates

Build and maintain pivot tables to analyze:

CPA trends

CTR, CPC, CVR performance

Creative performance

Audience performance

Budget pacing by platform

Identify unusual performance changes and flag them to media buyers

Media Buyer Support

Prepare data sheets before optimization sessions

Maintain historical data for trend analysis

Support quarterly planning with performance summaries

Assist in forecasting and budget pacing sheets

Audit & Case Study Preparation

Pull last 60–90 days of structured data for new client audits

Maintain “before and after” performance data for case studies

Organize campaign structure and performance summaries for strategy reviews

Creative & Audience Insights (Advanced Responsibility)

Track which creatives and audiences perform best across clients

Maintain a creative performance library

Identify patterns across accounts that inform strategy



Required Experience & Skills

3+ years experience working with paid media platforms in an agency or in-house role

Strong working knowledge of:

Google Ads

Meta Ads Manager

LinkedIn Campaign Manager

Google Analytics (GA4)

Advanced proficiency in Excel and Google Sheets

Pivot tables (required)

Excel Formulas and data organization

Deep understanding of:

CPA, CPC, CTR, CVR, ROAS

Campaign ? Ad Set ? Ad structure

How performance data should be interpreted

Experience pulling reports directly from ad platforms

Extremely detail-oriented and process-driven



Nice to Have (Bonus Skills)

Looker Studio / Google Data Studio

Supermetrics or other data connectors

Understanding of UTMs and tracking structure

Experience creating standardized reporting templates



What Success Looks Like in This Role

Within 60 days, you will:

Own reporting for all SocialScience clients

Have standardized reporting templates across accounts

Provide media buyers with clean data before they begin optimizations

Identify performance issues before the team does

Maintain historical data that makes audits and case studies easy



You Are a Great Fit If You

Love working with data and spreadsheets

Notice patterns in numbers quickly

Prefer organized systems over messy information

Can follow processes exactly and consistently

Have worked inside ad platforms and understand how campaigns function

Take pride in accuracy and reliability



Working Schedule

Must be available during overlapping hours with U.S. Eastern Time

Reporting cadence: Monday, Wednesday, Friday



How to apply:

1. Send your Portfolio and Resume to: 

2. Tell us a story of a significant event in your life that has shaped you





See you!

title: German Bilingual Support (WFH)
description:
We're looking for a qualified Help Desk Support (German Speaker). The ideal candidate should have excellent German oral and written communication skills. The Help Desk Support will be part of our team where they will be helping banks to assist their merchants. Assistance is needed for PCI certification of the merchants that help them against fraudulent attacks and other similar cases. Well-defined procedure is available for completion of work with the goal of delivering quality service both to banks and their merchants. We look for individuals who enjoy a challenge and mental exercise. This position is permanent work from home.



 Responsibilities:



-Respond to customer queries proficiently and professionally in consideration of quality expectations

-Attentively listen to each call and thoroughly read
s to probe what kind of assistance the customer requires

-Navigate through different applications and prepare information that is essential to remain on track during support

-Collaborate with the team and contribute to discussions on challenging queries

-Accurately update database and logs for seamless consolidation of the changes that ensue

-Understand that data are sensitive and unwarranted disclosure is avoided



Qualifications:



-Must be fluent in speaking and writing in the Spanish Language

-A BPO German Customer Support experience is a plus

-Basic computer knowledge and can work with office applications and navigating the Internet

-Interpersonal skills that aid in problem-solving and knowledge-sharing

-Calmness and collectedness under pressure

-Accuracy and attention to detail

-Apt learning and understanding of foreign concepts

-Commitment to quality service based on customer's needs

-Has the ability to empathize with customer concerns

-Good at providing instructions

-Amenable to midshift/graveyard shift.

-Workplace should be conducive, free from background noise

title: Roadside Assistance Inbound Sales & Dispatch Specialist
description:
(Growth Pathway to Sales Manager / Team Leader)



Company: Staff Connect (on behalf of our client)

Location: Remote – Philippines-based

Schedule: Rotating shifts between 5:00 PM – 9:00 AM AEDT

Employment Type: Full-time

Compensation: Competitive salary (based on experience and qualifications)

Leave: One week paid leave per year



About the Client



Our client is Australia’s largest misfuelling specialist, providing nationwide roadside assistance to motorists who a
 put the wrong fuel in their vehicle. When drivers are stressed and stranded, their team steps in to turn the situation around — quickly, professionally, and with empathy.



Staff Connect is supporting the client in building their first offshore team in the Philippines, offering a genuine opportunity for high performers to grow into leadership roles and eventually manage an entire offshore operation.



The Role

Inbound Sales & Dispatcher



Growth Pathway: Sales Manager / Team Leader



You will start in a frontline Inbound Sales & Dispatch role, handling incoming calls, assisting distressed customers, and coordinating technicians across Australia.



As you demonstrate strong sales ability, attention to detail, and initiative, you’ll progressively take on operations, quality control, and leadership responsibilities, with a clear pathway to advance into a Sales Manager / Team Leader position.



Key Responsibilities

Core Dispatch & Inbound Sales

- Act as the first point of contact for motorists who have misfuelled their vehicle.

- Use empathy and strong communication skills to convert inbound calls into confirmed bookings.

- Coordinate technicians nationwide using booking platforms and real-time tools.

- Collect deposits, log jobs accurately, and manage cases from start to completion.

- Communicate with customers and technicians via phone, Gmail, Slack, and SMS



Daily Operations & Quality Control

- Support fleet job closures, including managing long wait times when calling for PO numbers.

- Track spill kit usage by collecting all related
s and invoices in Xero (create only, do not send).

- Maintain accuracy in Xero and GeoOp, including:

- Reviewing previous day’s jobs for incomplete entries.

- Identifying jobs not properly closed or not sent to Xero.

- Perform call log clean-ups, ensuring:

- Objection reasons are correctly logged.

- ETAs, phone times, and job numbers are accurate.

- Sales opportunities are identified and closed.

- Discounts are properly logged and ticked.

- Act as a second set of eyes on GeoOp and call logs to catch errors, fill gaps, and prevent missed opportunities.



Documentation & Process Support

- Update fleet documents using new templates for consistency and clarity.

- Assist with process mapping, staff training, and continuous improvement initiatives.



Tech & Customer Support

- Coordinate servo runs and tech card runs to keep dispatch lines clear.

- Take ownership of escalated customer issues requiring extended phone support.

- Be comfortable being on camera during Slack huddles as part of daily operations.

- Participate in Slack huddles during shifts, including training, check-ins, and live support.



The Successful Candidate

- Minimum 2 years’ experience in a call centre, sales, or dispatch role.

- Proven success in sales conversion and customer service.

- Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.

- Calm under pressure, with strong empathy for customers in stressful situations.

- Tech-savvy, with proficiency in Google Chrome, Gmail, and Google Workspace.

- Comfortable using Slack, including joining huddles and appearing on camera when required.

- Experience working from home with reliable internet and a quiet workspace.

- Bonus: Experience in automotive, roadside assistance, or mobile repair.

- Bonus: Knowledge of Australian geography.



What’s in It for You

- Fully remote, work-from-home role.

- Work with a growing international client.

- Comprehensive training and ongoing support.

- Clear career progression: Dispatcher ? Sales Manager / Team Leader.

- Supportive, professional team culture.

- Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.

title: Paid Media Reporting & Analytics Specialist (Search & Social)
description:
Paid Media Reporting & Analytics Specialist (Search & Social)

Remote — Philippines | Full-Time

About SocialScience

SocialScience is a growth marketing agency that manages paid search and paid social campaigns for high-growth brands across B2B and DTC. We specialize in performance-driven creative testing and media strategy designed to reduce customer acquisition costs and scale revenue.

We are hiring a Paid Media Reporting & Analytics Specialist to become the central data engine behind all client performance reporting across platforms.

This is not a virtual assistant role. This is a performance marketing analytics role for someone who understands how ad platforms work and how to read, organize, and interpret paid media data.



Role Overview

You will be responsible for pulling, organizing, and analyzing performance data across multiple advertising platforms three times per week (Monday, Wednesday, Friday). You will maintain standardized reporting across clients, identify performance trends, and support our media buying team with clean, reliable data that helps drive decisions.

Over time, you will also help build cross-client insights, creative performance tracking, audit preparation, and budget pacing systems.

You will become the data nerve center for all SocialScience clients.



Key Responsibilities

Core Reporting (Primary Responsibility)

Pull performance reports from:

Google Ads

Meta Ads Manager

LinkedIn Campaign Manager

TikTok Ads Manager

Google Analytics (GA4)

Update master reporting sheets for all clients (3x per week)

Maintain consistent, accurate data across all client reporting templates

Build and maintain pivot tables to analyze:

CPA trends

CTR, CPC, CVR performance

Creative performance

Audience performance

Budget pacing by platform

Identify unusual performance changes and flag them to media buyers

Media Buyer Support

Prepare data sheets before optimization sessions

Maintain historical data for trend analysis

Support quarterly planning with performance summaries

Assist in forecasting and budget pacing sheets

Audit & Case Study Preparation

Pull last 60–90 days of structured data for new client audits

Maintain “before and after” performance data for case studies

Organize campaign structure and performance summaries for strategy reviews

Creative & Audience Insights (Advanced Responsibility)

Track which creatives and audiences perform best across clients

Maintain a creative performance library

Identify patterns across accounts that inform strategy



Required Experience & Skills

3+ years experience working with paid media platforms in an agency or in-house role

Strong working knowledge of:

Google Ads

Meta Ads Manager

LinkedIn Campaign Manager

Google Analytics (GA4)

Advanced proficiency in Excel and Google Sheets

Pivot tables (required)

Excel Formulas and data organization

Deep understanding of:

CPA, CPC, CTR, CVR, ROAS

Campaign ? Ad Set ? Ad structure

How performance data should be interpreted

Experience pulling reports directly from ad platforms

Extremely detail-oriented and process-driven



Nice to Have (Bonus Skills)

Looker Studio / Google Data Studio

Supermetrics or other data connectors

Understanding of UTMs and tracking structure

Experience creating standardized reporting templates



What Success Looks Like in This Role

Within 60 days, you will:

Own reporting for all SocialScience clients

Have standardized reporting templates across accounts

Provide media buyers with clean data before they begin optimizations

Identify performance issues before the team does

Maintain historical data that makes audits and case studies easy



You Are a Great Fit If You

Love working with data and spreadsheets

Notice patterns in numbers quickly

Prefer organized systems over messy information

Can follow processes exactly and consistently

Have worked inside ad platforms and understand how campaigns function

Take pride in accuracy and reliability



Working Schedule

Must be available during overlapping hours with U.S. Eastern Time

Reporting cadence: Monday, Wednesday, Friday



How to apply:

1. Send your Portfolio and Resume to: 

2. Tell us a story of a significant event in your life that has shaped you





See you!

title: Canva Template & Production Assistant
description:
We're looking for a full-time Canva Assistant to join the team.



Your work will be receiving images and text from another tea
mber, then aligning and placing them correctly into our existing 
 templates for our
 pages and blog sites. You'll also handle other simple admin tasks like airtable, generating captions via AI (copy-paste process following exact instructions). No creative design work, this is about accurately replicating templates.



This is high-volume repetitive work.



Requirements:

- Familiar with Canva

- Basic understanding of what looks visually appealing on

- Able to strictly follow templates and instructions

- Available 40+ hours per week



Important: This role requires working independently without constant guidance/hand-holding. If you need frequent confirmation, meetings, or step-by-step hand-holding, this role is not a fit.



Salary:

500 USD/month full time

(All tools/subscriptions are paid by us)



Hubstaff time tracker + NDA required.

Only apply if you want to work long-term on this over several months.



To apply, include:

- How familiar are you with Canva? (0-10)

- How many hours per week are you available?

- English (0-10)

- A short description of what your most recent job was (summarize it in 1-4 sentences what you worked on)



To confirm you read this entire listing, put in your proposal subject the word "FOCUS"

title: B2B Sales Agent
description:
How to Apply

* Send your most updated resume to 



$8-10/hour + Performance Incentives

Remote | Full-Time | Night Shift (US Hours)



About Us



We are Gushwork.ai — one of the fastest-growing AI marketing startups backed by global investors like Lightspeed, B Capital, and SIG. We help B2B manufacturing companies in the U.S. grow their online presence through AI-powered websites and SEO.



---

About the Role



We're hiring smart, energetic, and articulate Cold Callers / SDRs who can book appointments with decision-makers (owners, sales heads, marketing leads) of U.S. manufacturing companies.



Your mission? Spark meaningful conversations, qualify interest, and schedule discovery calls with our Account Executives.



---



What You'll Do



* Make
outbound calls daily to U.S.-based B2B leads

* Book 2 meetings every day

* Follow a proven cold-calling script (we’ll train you)

* Overcome objections and qualify prospects

* Book and schedule discovery meetings via Calendly

* Log activity in CRM and share daily call reports

* Collaborate with AEs to hand off booked meetings



---



What We’re Looking For



* 1+ year experience in B2B cold calling or appointment setting

* Excellent spoken English and confidence on phone

* Experience calling US-based businesses preferred

* Strong work ethic, coachability, and hunger to win

* Familiarity with Dialer Tools and Slack

* Willing to work night shifts (U.S. EST timezones)



---



Compensation



$8-10/hour base pay (paid weekly via Wise)

Attractive incentives for every qualified meeting and sales closed

Top performers can earn $400 per month in bonuses



---



How to Apply

* Send your most updated resume to 



---



IMPORTANT



This is a long-term role with growth opportunities. Please do not apply if you’re not comfortable with outbound calling or U.S. night shifts.

title: Back Office & Invoicing Specialist
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION



Back Office & Invoicing Specialist (Remote – Philippines)



Company: European Specialty Coffee & Distribution Group

Structure: Czech Operating Company + US Holding

Location: Remote (Philippines – CET overlap required)

Employment Type: Full-Time

Reports To: Senior Financial Controller



?



???? About Us



We are a European specialty coffee roasting, distribution, and service company headquartered in the Czech Republic with a US holding structure. Our operations include wholesale coffee, tea distribution, equipment service, and retail cafés.



We are implementing Odoo ERP to centralize order processing, accounting control, and operational workflows. We are seeking a highly organized Back Office & Invoicing Specialist to manage daily transactional processes and ensure accurate data entry within Odoo.



This role replaces a mixed customer service/accounting position and is focused on operational accuracy and financial discipline.



?



Position Overview



The Back Office & Invoicing Specialist is responsible for:

 • Processing all sales orders and invoices

 • Managing returns and credit notes

 • Bank reconciliation and payment pairing

 • Monitoring receivables and payables

 • Recording and monitoring expenses

 • Maintaining price lists

 • Assisting sales with accurate offers

 • Supporting cost control and profitability checks



This is a detail-oriented role requiring ERP experience and strong process discipline.



?



Key Responsibilities



1. Sales Order & Invoicing Management (Odoo)

 • Process B2B and monitor B2C orders in Odoo

 • Generate invoices and proforma invoices

 • Issue credit notes

 • Process returns and corrections

 • Ensure correct VAT application

 • Confirm pricing matches approved price lists

 • Coordinate with warehouse for shipment confirmation



?



2. Receivables & Bank Reconciliation

 • Daily bank transaction pairing

 • Match payments to invoices

 • Monitor Accounts Receivable aging

 • Flag overdue invoices to sales team

 • Prepare AR aging reports

 • Support collections tracking



?



3. Payables & Expense Monitoring

 • Record supplier invoices

 • Enter and categorize company expenses

 • Monitor expense documentation completeness

 • Track due dates of supplier payments

 • Assist in cost monitoring and expense reporting

 • Prepare documents for Senior Controller review



?



4. Pricing & Profitability Control

 • Maintain and update official price lists in Odoo

 • Ensure pricing consistency across clients

 • Double-check sales offers for correct margin application

 • Support sales team by preparing structured offers

 • Flag pricing anomalies to Controller or Managing Director

 • Monitor discount application accuracy



This role does NOT approve pricing changes but ensures correct execution.



?



5. ERP & E-Commerce Coordination

 • Work daily inside Odoo ERP

 • Support integration between Shopify and Odoo

 • Monitor order synchronization

 • Correct data discrepancies

 • Maintain accurate customer and product master data

 • Ensure tax mapping accuracy



Experience with Odoo, Zoho, or similar ERP systems preferred.

Experience with Shopify or other e-commerce platforms is highly valued.



?



6. Documentation & Compliance Preparation

 • Prepare monthly transaction exports

 • Organize VAT documentation

 • Maintain structured digital filing

 • Ensure audit trail readiness

 • Assist Senior Financial Controller in preparing documents for Czech external accounting firm



?



KPIs

 • Invoice accuracy ? 99.5%

 • Bank reconciliation completed daily

 • AR aging within agreed targets

 • Zero unauthorized pricing errors

 • Monthly closing support completed by Day 3

 • Clean and organized digital documentation



?



Required Qualifications

 • 3+ years experience in back office, accounting support, or invoicing

 • Experience with ERP systems (Odoo preferred)

 • Experience with accounting software

 • Experience with Shopify or e-commerce platforms preferred

 • Strong Excel skills

 • Understanding of receivables and payables processes

 • High attention to detail

 • Strong written and verbal English

 • Ability to work CET overlapping hours



?



Ideal Candidate Profile

 • Extremely organized

 • Process-driven

 • Comfortable with repetitive but critical tasks

 • Strong numerical accuracy

 • Understands margin logic

 • Proactive in identifying discrepancies

 • Not afraid to question incorrect data

 • Comfortable working in structured reporting environment



?



This Role Is NOT

 • A sales role

 • A strategic finance role

 • A pricing approval role

 • A decision-making accounting position



It is a structured execution and control role within ERP.



?



What We Offer

 • Stable long-term position

 • Direct integration into European business structure

 • Professional ERP exposure

 • Growth opportunity into Senior Accounting role

 • Competitive compensation based on experience

 • Remote work with structured management



?



To Apply



Please send:

 • Updated CV to 

 • ERP experience details (Odoo, Zoho, etc.)

 • Accounting software experience

 • E-commerce platform experience (if any)

 • Availability (hours per week)

 • Expected monthly salary

title: Property Management Virtual Assistant
description:
We are looking for a reliable Virtual Assistant who can stay online most of the time and reply to guest or tenant inquiries within 5–10 minutes maximum.



Most messages will come from rental platforms such as Airbnb, Zillow, 
, and similar platforms, so fast and professional communication is very important.



The workload is usually light (about 2–3 hours of active work per day), since messages do not come continuously. However, you must be available to respond quickly. For payment purposes, this role will be counted as 2 hours per day.



If you can add value to our company, handle communication efficiently, and help improve our occupancy rate, there will be an opportunity to move into a full-time position based on your performance and experience.

title: FITNESS DM APPOINTMENT SETTER
description:
UpOne Coaching is a premium 1-1 online fitness coaching brand helping busy, career-driven men transform their body and confidence through structured training, nutrition, and accountability.



We have 500,000+ organic followers, consistent inbound demand, and a proven system.



We’re now looking to bring on one experienced appointment setter to support both inbound and outbound conversations as we scale.



This Role Is For You If:

- You have prior appointment-setting experience (fitness or high-ticket preferred)

- You’re confident handling inbound and outbound Instagram DMs

- You know how to qualify properly without being pushy

- You value systems, structure, and feedback

This is not a beginner role and not a closing position.



Responsibilities

- Handle inbound Instagram DMs

- Run structured outbound outreach

- Qualify leads using a proven framework

- Book qualified strategy calls

- Maintain clean tracking in ManyChat / CRM

- Follow up with warm leads



Compensation

- Performance-based commission

- $2,000–$3,000 USD/month earning potential

- Clear progression for strong performers



Trial

All applicants who move forward will complete a paid 7-day paid trial.



How to Apply

Send a short message including:

- Your name

- Your prior appointment-setting experience

We’ll review applications and potentially move you to Stage 2.



We’re building long-term, not cycling freelancers. If you care about quality, structure, and growth, this role is worth applying for.

title: Appointment Setter
description:
Title: Appointment Setter

Hours: Full-time | Time Zone: U.S. Business Hours

Pay: Base $1,200 + per-meeting commission (OTE)



About the Role

We’re a U.S.-based legal-marketing company helping law firms grow through lead generation. As a BDR / Appointment Setter, you’ll make outbound calls to law-firm decision-makers, introduce our software, and book discovery meetings for our sales team. We provide scripts and leads—but top performers improve the process, capture insights, and drive results. First 2 months pay full OTE; after that, base + commission.



Who You Are:

- Confident, persuasive, and resilient with no fear of rejection

- Excellent spoken English (minimal accent)

- Results-driven and self-motivated

- Comfortable making high-volume outbound calls and managing your pipeline

- Tech-savvy; quick to learn CRMs and dialers (Zoho, Vonage, etc.)



What You’ll Do:

- Call law-firm prospects daily to secure qualified appointments

- Tailor messaging, handle objections, and log activity in CRM

- Maintain high-volume activity (hundreds of calls weekly)

- Book 5+ meetings/week during ramp; 10/week = top performer

- Collaborate with the team to improve scripts, leads, and outreach strategy



Requirements:

- 1+ years in outbound sales, BDR/SDR, or appointment-setting roles (U.S. client experience preferred)

- Proven track record hitting meeting or sales targets

- Strong phone presence and professional communication

- Comfortable using CRMs, dialers, and tracking performance

- Reliable internet and quiet remote workspace



Preferred:

- Experience calling law firms or professional-services companies

- BDR/SDR experience in high-volume outbound environments

- Sales experience in lead generation, marketing, or SaaS targeting U.S. markets



Why Join Us:

If you’re ambitious, coachable, and motivated by measurable goals, you’ll thrive here. Build your skills, grow your career, and help law firms succeed—all from your home office.

. DMs are not monitored.

title: Social Media Manager
description:
We are a fast-growing sports media brand with a strong focus on football, and we are seeking a proactive, creative, organized, and strategic Social Media Manager & Lead Generation Specialist. This role is essential to our growth, elevating our brand’s online presence, driving audience engagement, and generating quality leads that contribute to our revenue goals.



Key Responsibilities

- Manage and scale all social media channels, including Instagram, TikTok,
, and YouTube.

- Collaborate with our in-house content editor to ensure consistent delivery of high-quality, on-brand content.

- Work closely with our brand strategist to maintain alignment in messaging, positioning, and visual identity.

- Plan, schedule, and publish content across platforms while monitoring performance metrics and implementing data-driven improvements.

- Engage with the community across comments, messages, and other touchpoints to foster a strong online presence.

- Conduct outreach to brands for sponsorships, partnerships, and collaboration opportunities.

- Run, manage, and optimize
 advertising campaigns, with additional platform experience considered an advantage.

- Stay up-to-date with football trends, news, and emerging opportunities to create timely and relevant content.

- Propose new ideas and actively contribute to shaping the long-term social media strategy.

- Produce quick, simple edits for reels, stories, graphics, or carousels

 (major video editing is handled by our in-house editor).

- Assist with minor administrative tasks when needed to support overall team operations.



Qualifications

- Full-time availability (40 hours/week) aligned with Australian time zone / Philippine daytime hours.

- Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and a consistent professional work ethic.

- Demonstrated understanding of brand aesthetics, storytelling, and effective content execution.

- Proficiency in social media analytics, scheduling tools, and performance measurement.

- Experience in brand and influencer outreach is a plus.

- Working knowledge of basic editing tools (e.g., Canva, CapCut).

- Self-driven, reliable, and able to work effectively in a remote, collaborative environment.



Why Join Us

- Opportunity to contribute meaningfully to the growth of an international sports brand.

- Supportive and collaborative work culture.

- Long-term role with potential for professional growth and expansion of responsibilities.

- A dynamic environment where creativity and initiative are valued.





If you are strategic, proactive, and passionate about social media and sports, we invite you to apply and play a key role in our continued growth.

title: AI Video Creator
description:
About Us: We're a leading Australian luxury bathroom and kitchen products retailer. We're looking for a creative AI video specialist to help us showcase dream bathroom designs through stunning Instagram Reels.



The Role: This is a focused, full-time position where you'll create AI-generated videos of beautiful bathroom interiors featuring our luxury products. If you can do this one task exceptionally well, that's all we need.



What You'll Do:



Generate high-quality AI videos of dream bathroom interiors in styles like modern luxury, contemporary, Japandi, and Scandinavian

Create content suitable for Instagram Reels (vertical format, engaging, eye-catching)

Incorporate our luxury bathroom products into the designs

Produce consistent, scroll-stopping content that showcases aspirational bathroom spaces



What We're Looking For:



Proficiency in AI tools (MidJourney, Veo3, Higgsfield, or similar)

Understanding of what makes engaging Instagram Reels content

Eye for contemporary luxury interior design and modern aesthetics (Japandi, Scandinavian, minimalist styles)

Ability to create polished, professional-looking videos

Reliable and able to produce content consistently

Strong creative judgement, adaptability, and ability to work independently with minimal revisions

Suitable for Instagram Reels format (vertical, 9:16 ratio)

High quality and visually stunning

Showcase modern luxury styles (contemporary, Japandi, Scandinavian, etc.)

Use products from this folder to create your videos: 

Show us your best work!



To Apply: Complete this Google Form with your trial videos:

After successfully completing the trial and joining us full-time, all required subscriptions (Adobe Creative Suite, MidJourney, Veo3, Runway, etc.) will be provided at our cost.

title: Executive Assistant & Operations Coordinator (E-commerce Coffee Company) *Full Time, Remote|Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
Are you ready…

To start a role that motivates and excites you?

And a position where we invest in your learning, education, and growth?



Then keep reading, we want to work with you!





WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS POSITION:

This is not your typical support role — you’ll work directly with our founders, influence company-wide systems, and gain exposure to every part of the business.



Incredible company culture:

• Small, close team with collaborative, friendly and open culture.

• We believe the biggest asset of a company is our people. We focus on helping each tea
mber reach their full potential by investing in their learning, growth, skills, and education. When we grow as individuals, we succeed as a team.

• Not a fan of office politics or drama? We’re on the same page. Instead of wasting time with that, we focus on solving problems and reaching goals

• 100% remote, enjoy the comfort and flexibility of working from home



Pay, benefits, progression, and long-term growth:

• Competitive salary

• Benefits including up to 16 days a year Paid Time off

• Progression as we grow: greater responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased pay.

• Feel empowered, make decisions, have an impact

• Grow with the company and live up to your potential!

• Join an exciting, fast-growing company!







ABOUT US:

We’re a young, ambitious, and small (but growing!) company that’s making a massive impact in ecommerce. 



Since 2015 we’ve been obsessed with building award-winning products and awesome brands that people fall in love with. We have 2 primary brands in our portfolio: 

(1) an international award-winning coffee products brand 
 / 
).

(2) an educational coaching program that helps entrepreneurs grow their businesses to create a positive impact in the world!



Our two recent flagship products became the world’s most successful launches in their categories. We’ve shipped more than 200,000 orders worldwide and we’re continuing to expand.



Our culture is transparent and candid. You’re always welcome (and encouraged!) to ask questions or express a difference of opinion. Learning and growth is a cornerstone of our culture, both personally and professionally. We work hard, and we have fun!







WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented team player to fill this role—someone who thrives on solving problems, staying organized, and making things run smoothly across departments.



Do you love helping customers, supporting a team, and keeping operations organized? Do you get satisfaction from making systems work better and “getting things done”? If yes, we want you on our team!



You’re probably the type of person who:

• Enjoys supporting others and finding solutions to problems

• Has strong communication and organizational skills

• Likes working behind the scenes to make sure everything runs like clockwork

• Is excited to wear multiple hats and be part of a growing, fast-moving company

• Has worked directly with founders or in a startup, and enjoys that fast-paced, flexible vibe

We’re not just looking for someone who can support our team, we’re looking for someone to be proactive with taking ownership of tasks, solve problems independently, and grow into larger responsibilities over time.







YOUR OPPORTUNITY AND ROLE ON THE TEAM:

Our culture is collaborative, friendly, and open. We hire people who are smart, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn and grow.



Sound like you? This is an exciting long-term opportunity!



This is a fully remote position. You’ll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our small but mighty team to support customer happiness, streamline operations, and take on projects that help the business grow. 



This is a foundational role — one where you’ll gain visibility into all parts of the company.



As you grow, your role will grow with you, based on your interests and strengths:

• Want to work improving our systems and processes? Awesome!

• Have ideas on how to improve our website? Fantastic!

• Want to learn how to manage projects? Let’s go!



We’re not just hiring for a role — we’re hiring for potential. 



Your responsibilities will span 4 key areas: customer experience (30-40%), operations/logistics (20-30%), executive support (10-20%), and special projects (10-20%) — giving you exposure across the business. These percentages are estimates and you can expect your day-to-day to shift and evolve as the business grows and as you take ownership. 



1. Customer Experience

• Provide
/chat-based support for our customers across our channels (Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale)

• Answer order and product questions, resolve issues promptly, and ensure customers feel heard and supported

• Support wholesale partners with order updates, invoicing, and coordination



2. Order Management & Platform Coordination

• Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot orders across Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale channels

• Troubleshoot and resolve shipping or fulfillment issues with partners and customers

• Maintain accurate product listings, inventory data, and logistics information across platforms



3. Executive & Admin Support

• Manage founder and team inboxes, schedule meetings, and organize internal documentation

• Assist with travel bookings, meeting preparation, and note-taking

• Support small projects by tracking timelines, managing tasks, and ensuring follow-through



4. Special Projects & Company Operations

• Conduct research projects to support decision-making (tools, systems, competitors)

• Support lead generation efforts through identifying new wholesale prospects, brand partners, or influencers

• Support planning and execution of events, expos, or marketing campaigns — manage timelines, logistics, and tasks

• Document and maintain SOPs for operational clarity and training

• Test and troubleshoot web pages, workflows, or customer journeys to ensure quality and functionality

• Take ownership of ad hoc “figure it out” tasks — we’ll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You’ll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we’ll support your learning — but we’re looking for someone who’s excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves — as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you’ll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

• 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

• 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

• Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

• Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills — you’re detail-obsessed and on top of things

• Proactive problem-solver — you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

• Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

• Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

• Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

• Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

• Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

• Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

• “Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus”







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it’s too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you’re still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we’d love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has other benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our interview process extremely quick and efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Get started with a quick Initial Screening here for us to get to know you: 

2. Complete the screening and we’ll be in touch with next steps once we receive it.





The position is on a first come first review basis, so the sooner you complete the screening, the more likely you'll get hired.



Good luck, and we hope to have someone awesome like you to join us!

title: Accounting & Tax Virtual Assistant (Junior to Mid-Level, Australia-Focused)
description:
We are looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Accounting and Tax Virtual Assistant to support our team with Australian tax, compliance, and accounting tasks. We're seeking someone with a broader understanding of Australian accounting standards, BAS/IAS compliance, and business tax reporting.



This role is ideal for a junior to mid-level candidate who is comfortable working virtually, has strong proficiency in Xero, and is eager to grow their career in virtual accounting services with an Australian focus.



Core Competencies

- Hands-on experience in Australian accounting and tax

- Proficiency in Xero (Australian version); experience with QuickBooks or MYOB is a plus

- Ability to handle a variety of accounting tasks, including:

- BAS and IAS preparation and lodgement

- GST, PAYG, and Superannuation compliance

- Preparation of financial reports for businesses, trusts, or companies

- Familiarity with Division 7A, FBT, CGT, and PSI rules (a bonus, not a must)

- Support for business tax return preparation and small business tax strategies



Preferred Qualifications

- CPA certification or working towards CPA is preferred but not essential

- 1–4 years of experience in an Australian accounting role

- Prior experience working remotely or in a virtual assistant capacity is a plus

- Technical Skills

- Strong knowledge of Xero, including:

- Tax code setup and reconciliation (GST, GST-free, input-taxed)

- BAS/IAS preparation and submission through ATO Portal

- Payroll processing in compliance with STP and Superannuation

- Ability to generate and interpret financial statements and management reports

- Skilled in using Excel or Google Sheets for tax tracking, analysis, and reconciliations

- Familiarity with tools like TaxCalc, Business Fitness Workpapers, and ATO online services



What You'll Do

- Support and work with accountants with day-to-day tasks relating to Australian tax compliance

- Assist in the preparation of business activity statements (BAS), payroll, and reconciliations

- Manage financial records with attention to accuracy and ATO compliance

- Help prepare documentation for year-end tax returns and reports

- Maintain clear communication and reliable task tracking in a remote setting



This is a long-term, remote opportunity for someone who is ready to move beyond data entry and basic bookkeeping and gain deeper experience in Australian tax and financial support. You’ll work alongside experienced accountants and be part of a collaborative team. Apply now if you're detail-driven, tech-savvy, and committed to helping businesses meet their compliance and financial goals.

 and kindly indicate in your
 the role you are applying for.

title: Mortgage Broker Virtual Assistant (Full-time) (Remote)
description:

- Support brokers in comprehensive loans processing tasks including data entry, application submissions, and client interaction.

Requirements:

- Proficient in Microsoft Office; familiarity with ApplyOnLine and Connective's Mercury is advantageous.

- Strong attention to detail, proactive approach, and ability to work independently with minimal supervision.



Why Join Us?

Ready to Apply?

title: API Integration Developer — E-commerce SaaS Platform
description:
We're a growing tech studio building an AI-powered SaaS platform for brands. We need a skilled developer to own our API integration layer — setting up, building, and maintaining connections to major e-commerce and advertising platforms.



What you'll be doing:



•Setting up developer accounts and obtaining API credentials for platforms like Google Ads, Shopify, Klaviyo, TikTok Ads, Amazon Ads, and Postscript

•Building and maintaining OAuth 2.0 authentication flows

•Creating reliable data sync pipelines that pull platform data into our application

•Implementing token refresh logic, error handling, and retry mechanisms

•Setting up and managing webhook receivers for real-time data updates

•Writing clean, well-documented TypeScript code that integrates with our existing codebase

•Troubleshooting API issues, rate limits, and platform-specific quirks



Our tech stack:



•Next.js / React / TypeScript

•Prisma ORM / PostgreSQL

•Deployed on Vercel

•AI layer powered by Anthropic Claude

•Agentic Saas



What we're NOT looking for:



•Someone who only knows WordPress or basic HTML/CSS

•Someone who hasn't worked with APIs in production

•Someone who needs hand-holding on OAuth flows



Requirements



Must have:



•3+ years of experience with REST API integrations



•Hands-on experience implementing OAuth 2.0 flows in production



•Experience with at least 2 of these APIs: Shopify Admin API, Meta/Facebook Marketing API, Google Ads API, Klaviyo API, Amazon Ads API



•Strong proficiency in TypeScript and Node.js



•Experience with Next.js API routes



•Familiarity with PostgreSQL and an ORM (Prisma preferred)



•Experience handling webhook receivers and token refresh in production



•Solid understanding of error handling, rate limiting, and retry patterns



Nice to have:



•Experience with multiple ad platform APIs



•Experience with Vercel deployments



•Familiarity with e-commerce data models (orders, customers, campaigns, metrics)



•Experience building data sync/ETL pipelines



Screening Questions (include in application)



1.

Which e-commerce or ad platform APIs have you personally integrated with? Describe what you built.



2.

Walk me through how you'd implement an OAuth 2.0 flow for Google Ads in a Next.js app.



3.

How do you handle token expiration and refresh in production?



4.

If given API docs and credentials, how long would it take you to build a complete OAuth flow and data sync for a platform like Shopify, TikTok, Stripe?



5.

What's your availability and expected monthly rate?



6.

Do you have any experience with OpenClaw?

title: Content Assistant
description:
We are looking for a reliable, disciplined, and detail-oriented assistant to support our daily UGC (User-Generated Content) operations. This role focuses on maintaining consistency and accuracy in managing creator-submitted content.



Your responsibilities will include logging into our ARUGC creator platform each day, downloading newly submitted videos, and testing, reviewing, and organizing one new video daily. You will upload approved content to our internal website, carefully review attached metadata for completeness and accuracy, and submit finalized files along with their metadata to the manager for review and approval.



The workload is light and typically takes around one hour per day; however, consistency, attention to detail, and the ability to follow processes precisely are essential. This position is ideal for someone who is self-motivated, organized, and comfortable working independently on recurring daily tasks while ensuring high-quality content management.

title: Web and Marketing Designer
description:
Job Description: Web + Marketing Designer (Wix Studio, Canva, Figma)



If you love turning messy notes into clean, on-brand pages… and you get weirdly excited about a well-structured resource hub (like “ah yes, hierarchy ????”), this might be your lane.



We’re looking for a Web + Marketing Designer who can help us ship a backlog of website pages and marketing assets fast—without needing constant approvals. This isn’t a “just make pretty things” role. It’s a take-ownership, ship consistently, and make the brand feel instantly more professional kind of role.



?



Your impact



Within 90 days, you’ll own a steady pipeline of polished web and marketing assets. You’ll help us:

 • launch a content/resource hub with 20–25 high-quality pages

 • create clean, consistent marketing + client education materials

 • speed up how we communicate with clients (clearer visuals, better pages, smoother onboarding)



?



What you’ll do



Website build-outs (core focus)

 • Build and refresh 20–25 website pages to kickstart a content/resource hub (feature launches, SOP-style guides, education pages)

 • Work mainly in Wix Studio (if you’re strong in WordPress/CMS and can ramp fast, that’s totally acceptable)

 • Turn rough wireframes/notes into polished pages with strong layout, hierarchy, and readability

 • Make smart design decisions independently (no “waiting for the founder to approve every pixel” energy)



Marketing + client-education assets

 • Create branded assets in Canva (LinkedIn carousel/swipe posts, onboarding visuals, lightweight collateral)

 • Maintain brand consistency using our brand kit (fonts, colours, spacing, tone)

 • Produce Figma mockups when needed (page concepts, component ideas, layout explorations) and translate them into live pages



Light ops + communication support (small but helpful)

 • Support basic operations:
 triage, draft/reply to simple messages, flag priority items

 • Gradually step into client onboarding/follow-ups once you understand the business (you may be looped into onboarding comms or occasional calls)



How we collaborate

 • Daily comms:

 • Files/docs: Google Workspace

 • Documentation: Confluence (easy to learn)



?



Must-have qualifications (self-check)

 • Formal design education (degree, diploma, or recognised certification) — not purely self-taught

 • Strong portfolio showing web + marketing design (live links and/or case studies)

 • Confident in Canva (independent creation of marketing assets)

 • Confident in Figma (UI/UX mockups, layouts, components)

 • Web platform capability: Wix Studio preferred, or strong WordPress/CMS experience and can ramp quickly

 • Professional, client-ready English (written + spoken)

 • Comfortable working with autonomy and initiative (minimal hand-holding)

 • Secure home office + reliable internet



?



Nice to have (but not required)

 • Wix Studio experience specifically (responsive rules, components, Studio builder)

 • Experience designing education/resource hubs, knowledge bases, or feature launch pages

 • Basic copywriting / UX writing instincts

 • Confluence familiarity or experience documenting workflows

 • Comfortable using AI tools to speed up drafts (with good judgment)



?



Success outcomes (30 / 60 / 90 days)



30 days — settled in + shipping

 • Learn the brand + cadence

 • Ship your first pages/assets with minimal revisions

 • Establish a weekly rhythm (plan early-week, deliver end-week)



60 days — consistent output

 • Reliably produce high-quality pages and Canva assets end-to-end

 • Confidently handle simple client follow-ups/onboarding comms



90 days — pipeline owner

 • Own the web + marketing design pipeline

 • Clear the initial backlog of pages

 • Reduce founder involvement to quick reviews vs constant direction



?



Why this role matters



The business is growing and shipping features, but design + content updates are bottlenecked by founder capacity. Your work directly improves:

 • how customers understand the product

 • how polished the brand looks

 • how smooth onboarding feels



If you want a role that starts design-heavy and can grow into broader ops/client support, you’ll fit here.
